Carlos es un joven muy trabajador, la palabra trabajo es hacer de todo con tal que sea una actividad honrada, ha trabajado vendiendo ropa, ha sido mozo en un restaurante y ha trabajo en el servicio de limpieza, aprendió a los 12 años a manejar en motocicleta y fue desde ese instante que le gusto mucho que siempre quiso comprarse una moto, sus padres al ver que quería tanto tener una moto, que le compraron una (aunque de segunda mano por cierto).

Carlos se dedica actualmente a realizar movilidad de pasajeros por las calles de su barrio y es así que lleva en este negocio hace tres años dándole mucha fuerza a su trabajo, trabaja diariamente 12 horas sin parar  dese las cuatro de la tarde hasta las cinco de la maña del día siguiente, el es muy responsable y por eso el cree que su responsabilidad es la base para que le vaya bien en su negocio y sobre todo porque es muy carismático y trabajador, el está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias a ese apoyo el podrá comprar otra moto  de segunda mano para seguir realizando movilidad de pasajeros, ello mejorar su negocio ya que tendrá un vehículo mas para trabajar y tendrá mayores ingresos, para poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Estudiar  la carrera de Mecánica”
texts.en:
Carlos Alfredo, 21, lives with his mother, in the city of Cañete, located about an hour and a half south of Lima. Cañete, with its sandy beaches, pre-Inca ruins, and the production of the beloved national liquor, Pisco (a type of grape brandy) has long been a destination for wealthy Peruvians. Cañete is a warm and quiet city with a large African-Peruvian population, the rest from an indigenous path and the influences of the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the earthquakes that occurred in 2001 and 2007 in Peru, but has borne the brunt of nature as it has for much of its history.

Carlos is a young hard working man.  The word job is to make everything be honest activity.  He has worked selling clothes, was a waiter in a restaurant and has worked in housekeeping.  He learned to drive a motorcycle at 12 years old and it was from that moment he loved it and always wanted to buy a bike.  His parents, seeing that he really wanted to have a bike, bought him one (even though it was second hand).

Carlos is currently working by transporting passengers through the streets of his neighborhood and has been in business three years, giving him much strength to work.  He works 12 hours non-stop daily from four in the afternoon until five in the morning the following day.  He is very responsible and believes that his responsibility is the basis for doing well in his business and above all because he is very charismatic and hardworking.  He is very grateful to the KIVA lenders because, thanks to that support, he will be able to buy another second-hand bike to continue moving passengers, thereby improving his business since he will have another vehicle to work and have higher incomes in order to fulfill his greatest dream: "To study the career of Mechanic"

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is married with nine children. 
Luz has a snack vending business and earns approximately 1,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. 
Luz has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Luz hopes to see her children finish their studies in order to help their financial problems. Luz is a hardworking mother and a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: La señora Yanet  se desempeña como Diseñadora de alta costura, profesión que fue  aprendiendo  de su madre y estudios que realizo en escuelas de costura para perfeccionar su trabajo. Yanet cuenta con su propio taller de costura en su propia vivienda en un local especialmente para realizar sus trabajos. En este momento quiere comprar la materia prima como lo es tela, hilos, agujas, botones y más, porque aparte de que los clientes le solicitan alguna costura también hace algunos diseños para vender. Los trabajo que mas realiza son vestidos de novia y quince años, trajes, sacos, bastillas y demás variedad. Yanet y su esposo tienen una hija por la que quieren que tenga un mejor patrimonio y un buen estudio por lo que trabajan mucho para lograr su objetivo
texts.en: Yanet works as a high-fashion designer, a profession which she learned over time from her mother and from courses she took at dressmaking schools in order to perfect her work. Yanet has her own tailoring workshop, located within her home in an area specially set up for her to carry out her work. At this time she would like to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, buttons and other items, because apart from the orders she receives from her customers, she also creates some designs to sell. The work she does most includes making wedding dresses, dresses for 15th birthday parties, suits and suit jackets, hemming garments, and a variety of others. Yanet and her husband have a daughter, for whom they would like to provide a better start in life and a good education. For this reason, they work hard to achieve their goal.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Renie

texts.en: Renie is 24 years old and lives in Pob 2, Oroquieta City. He is married with one child. Renie has an automotive shop business and earns approximately PHP  8,000 each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase equipment for his auto repair shop. Renie has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: La señora luz María  desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y zapatos en una pulga muy concurrida de la ciudad donde le va muy bien con sus ventas. Ella ha demostrado ser una mujer trabajadora que a pesar de la crisis no ha dejado su negocio, ya que es donde tiene ingresos para mantener a sus 2 hijos los cuales están edad escolar que necesitan atención y este trabajo le permite poder realizar las actividades necesarias porque el negocio solo lo pone los fines de semana . Luz María desea que se le apoye con capital para poder surtirse de mercancía para la temporada de frio y así estar preparada para el nuevo cambio climático.
texts.en: Luz Maria has been selling used clothing and shoes in a very busy flea market in the city, and she's been doing very well with her sales.  She has been shown to be a very hardworking woman who, in spite of the economic crisis, has not given up on her business, since this is where she gets the income to support her 2 children.  Her children are school-aged and need to be cared for, and this work allows her to carry out the activities she needs to do because she runs the business only on the weekends.  Luz Maria is requesting support with capital that will allow her to stock up with merchandise for the colder months, so that she will be prepared for the upcoming change in climate.

loans.use: to buy jackets, sweaters, pants and other items

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe es casada tiene 1 hijo que aun depende de ella económicamente, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y no descuidar la familia, cuida 4 niños en su casa. Desde hace 7 años su esposo adquirió una casa de interés social donde actualmente viven, las paredes se están deteriorando lo que necesita un mantenimiento y también quiere poner piso de concreto porque en temporadas de lluvias se hace un charco y mucho lodo. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena, yeso y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Guadalupe is married and has a son who is still economically dependent upon her. To help her husband with household expenses and to avoid neglecting her family, she cares for 4 children in her house. Some 7 years ago, her husband acquired a publicly-subsidized house where we presently live. The walls are deteriorating and in need of maintenance. Also, I want to install a concrete floor because during the rainy season, the floor becomes one big puddle and quite muddy. To carry out the project, we need to buy cement, sand, and plaster, and to pay the workers.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for needed home improvements.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana y su esposo son una pareja de edad adulta y sus  hijos que tuvieron ya son personas que están mayores y ya formaron sus propias familia. Por lo que estas personas ya se encuentran solos, que solo dependen de su misma pensión que reciben cada mes. Juana  quiere terminar la barda de enfrente de su casa que hace años solo puso una maya ciclónica para protegerse de los delincuentes pero no es suficiente por eso quiere ponerla de block para que este mejor resistente. Para esto necesita comprar cemento, varilla, arena y pagar mano de obra de esta manera quedara concluido su proyecto.
texts.en: Mrs. Juana and her husband are an elderly couple and their adult children are older and have already formed their own family. So they are already alone, and only depend on the same pension they receive each month.  Juana wants to finish the fence in front of her house that years ago she only put a chain-link to protect herself against offenders but it is not enough so she wants to put a block for better resistance. For this she needs to buy cement, rod, sand and pay for labor so the project will be completed.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Graciela Cecilia

texts.es:
Graciela Cecilia, es una mujer muy segura, luchadora y sobre todo que no se rinde ante nada, tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 2 hijas, una se llama Antuanett y la otra se llama Olenka, es separada, vela por sus hijas sola y lo ha hecho muy bien  ya que sus hijas están muy orgullosas de ella. 

Ella es muy fuerte y es una madre emprendedora,  ha trabajado de todo, para poder llevar dinero a su hogar, ha trabajado vendiendo pollo en el mercado, también ha trabajado como empleada de limpieza en otras casas y es que ella no tiene vergüenza de trabajar con tal que sea un trabajo honrado siempre es bueno, Graciela se dedica actualmente a su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y golosinas en horas de la noche a las afueras de una empresa desde hace 6 años, como es tan luchadora, trabaja por las mañanas en una empresa pero haciendo las labores de limpieza, se que se preguntaran como hace para tener 2 trabajos a la vez y es que ella nos dice que sus hijas son la fuerza que ella necesita para seguir y es lo único que la mantiene en la lucha por salir adelante.

Graciela está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva porque con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para poder tener más variedad de producto que ofrecer a sus clientes, con esta mejora podrá tener más ingresos y ahorrar para tener un negocio más grande, para así  poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” ver a sus hijas profesionales “
texts.en:
Graciela Cecilia is a very secure woman, a fighter and above all, does not give in to anything.  She is 42 years old, separated, and has 2 daughters, Antuanette and Olenka, whom she cares for alone and has done very well since her daughters are very proud of her.

She is very strong and is an enterprising mother who has worked all over to bring money home. She has worked selling chicken in the market, and also as a cleaner in other homes and she is not ashamed to work provided it is honest work.  Graciela is in the business of selling hamburgers and snacks in the evening outside a company for 6 years now, as she is a fighter, she works in the mornings at a company, but doing the cleaning, she wondered how to do to 2 jobs at once and she tells us that her daughters are the strength she needs to continue and is the only thing that keeps her in the struggle for get ahead.

Graciela is very grateful to KIVA lenders because with the help they have given her, she will purchase more merchandise to have more variety of products to offer to her customers.  With this improvement, she may have more income and save for a larger business so that she can fulfill her greatest dream: "to see her daughters become professionals"

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise (hamburgers).

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in the Prey Chor district. She generates her income through selling groceries from a booth near her house. She is a mother of six children and only her last-born child is a single man who is now working in a neighboring country (Thailand) and sends part of his salary home to support the family. At present, Som owns just a few plots of farmland, which provide insufficient food for the whole year. As usual, she buys a stock of rice from local farmers in advance during the season to secure the family in the future. Thus, she is taking out a loan from HKL to purchase a stock of rice. Her business goal is to own a small store and sell groceries in a local market of the province.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. 

To make a living, Ma. Fe owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling weaved native mats to local businesses and community members. Ma. Fe has been in her business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Ma. Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture weaved native mats. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture weaved native mats

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Virginia manages a coconut plantation. Virginia has been in her business for 15 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2009, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Virginia is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is a 27-year-old guy who is the father of two children and lives with his family in a local ger (nomadic tent) district without basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His daughter attends secondary school while his spouse cares for their son who is only 3 years old. 

Since 2008, Boldbaatar has supported his family by operating a computer services business in the local area of the city. His daily duty is to provide computer services such as printing, text typing and etc. During the school season his business is very popular when students take finals and write reports. 

Thus, he is requesting a 1.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase some necessary computer equipment.

loans.use: to purchase some computer equipment

loans.name: Genna

texts.en:
Genna, is married and has six children. Genna is 46 years old, residing at Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Genna owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of office and school supplies to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2010, Genna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
This is Lilybeth, 35, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ferdinand, an overseas contract worker, and she is the mother of three children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Lilybeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products such as popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on for their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Lilybeth fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is married and has two children. She is 57 years old and resides at Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Conchita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. 

In 2009, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella, 40, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Wenceslao, her business partner, and is the mother of two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Bella operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetables in the community market. She buys larger quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells it by the kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She makes a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Bella dreams to be able to give all her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of fruits and vegetables needed in her business

loans.name: Tserendejid

texts.en: Tserendejid is 50 years old and lives with her son in a ger (Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She started her traditional clothes tailoring business in 1997 by supplying items to the markets. Her father taught her the skills of sewing when she was ten. Her sewing skills are excellent and her designs are very modern. Now that the holiday season is approaching, her product demand is increasing therefore, she's requesting 800,000 MNT to buy material to sew deel, a Mongolian traditional costume. She's a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I enjoy what I do. I am trying not to burden my children."

loans.use: To buy material to sew deel, a Mongolian traditional costume

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 39 years old, married and has three children. Two of the children work jobs while the youngest one is still studying. 
Shameem's husband is a driver and provides transportation services to his clients. He is very much an expert in driving and people trust his driving skills and feel safe while traveling in his vehicle. 
Shameem is a seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has good skills in sewing and receives a good number of orders every month. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband because he wants to buy new tires and also wants to repair his vehicle (a 32 seat van). 
By doing this, he will be able to drive his van more smoothly and provide better quality transportation services for the passengers. 
Shameem is hopeful that an investment will be more helpful for her husband in securing his business assets and will increase his income. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shameem”.

loans.use: To repair and buy new tires for a van.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 31 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs and feeds.

Merlinda has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to support her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs and feeds

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and other seafood to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish and other seafood to sell

loans.name: Replita

texts.en:
Replita is 54 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Replita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, canned goods, noodles, spices, etc.. 

In the future, Replita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rahana

texts.en:
Rahana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Rahana has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from dried fish vending.

Rahana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to buy farmland in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosela is 40 years old and four of her children are in school.

Rosela has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Rosela requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell in her meat stall.

Rosela has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Rosela would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional meat to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aileen is 52 years old and has three of her children are in school.

Aileen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Aileen has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 36 years old and married with two children.

Emily works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Emily has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Emily aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en: Otgonbaatar is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a chef in a local restaurant and his son is a school student. He started his furniture-making business in 1999. He makes his furniture at home and sells it at the market. His furniture is modern and highly qualified. Now that the holiday season is here, his product demand is increasing. Therefore, he needs to buy some efficient equipment and needs additional raw materials. He is a sharp and hardworking man who is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy equipment and raw materials.

loans.use: To buy equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Sha'migul

texts.ru: Шаъмигул 44 года. Она Вдова. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Шаъмигул печет лепешки для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки и масла.
texts.en: Sha'migul is 44 years old and a widow.  She has three children.  She has a high school education.  Sha'migul bakes and sells flat breads and has been engaged in this occupation for 12 years.  She is taking out a loan to buy flour and oil.

loans.use: to purchase flour and oil.

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en: Enhtur is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife is a clerk, and his elder kid is a college student. His middle kid is a school student and younger one is a kindergarten student. He started his car repairing business in 2005. His educational background is engineering. Therefore, he's an excellent repairman. Now that his daughter joined college, he has to increase his income. He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy an electric heater for his house.

loans.use: To buy an electric heater

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en: Otgonjargal is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is employed, her elder two kids are college students and her younger two are school students. Otgonjargal operates a water distribution business. She started her business in 1990. She runs a well. Her well is fairly profitable. However, her equipment is broken. Therefore, she's requesting 1,150,000 MNT to buy necessary equipment. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It has been horrible since my business gone down. I have to act aggressive in order to pay my children's college fee".

loans.use: To buy necessary equipment

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em sells groceries in front of her house located in Prey Chor district, earning approximately $1.50 per day to solve her basic living needs. She is now 49 and is a mother of nine children. As seven of her children are unemployed and depending on her income, this situation may lead her family into poverty and hunger. However, Em and her husband have to work harder outside of farming to solve this problem. 

And now Em would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase stocks of rice from local farmers and to secure her family's future. In the future, Em intends to build a proper store and sell many kinds of groceries to people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice from local farmers and to secure her family's future.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Муаззам 58 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Муаззам имеет среднее образование. Она открыла магазин, где продает продукты питания и парфюмерию. Торговлей она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Muazzam is 58 years old and married. She has four children. Muazzam has a high school education. She has opened a store, where she sells food and perfumes. She has worked with trade for five years. 

Muazzam takes a loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, sweets, wafers, cookies and fresh juices

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 36 years old, married and has one child. 

Jessica is in the agricultural business buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Jessica requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Jessica has been buying and selling livestock for four years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying & selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her buying & selling of used clothing business.

Jovy has been in this business for 20 years. Jovy earns more income from buying & selling jewelry.

Jovy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 28 years old and married with three children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a coconut wine retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been in the coconut wine retail business for 11 years and earns additional income from buying & selling livestock and running a general store.

Juliet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 64 years old and married with eight children.

Luzminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Luzminda has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and earns additional income from fish and meat vending.

Luzminda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk quantity that will allow her to offer better choice to her customers and increase her sales and income.
 
She is an experienced businesswoman and has been operating her business for many years. She knows the latest fashion trends very well and is confident that a loan investment will help her make more profits from her business. 

Her husband is a driver who provides transportation services to passengers. 

Sakina is a mother of four sons and three daughters. Her eldest son is a laborer while the six remaining children are getting their education. Sakina knows the importance of education and she is very hopeful that an increased income will help her continue giving education to her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Ma. Morita

texts.en:
Ma. Morita is 55 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Morita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Ma. Morita has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the ready-to-wear retail business for four years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Ma. Morita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 36 years old and married with two children who are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a business buying and selling snack foods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of snack foods to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more snack foods to sell

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 38 years old and married with four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Joy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 62 years old and married with six children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Natividad has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Natividad aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
Rodilyn is 52 years old, and married with six children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  Rodilyn has been farming rice for 20 years, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sayfuddin

texts.ru: Сайфуддин житель района Хуросон. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он вместе с женой занимается торговлей. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Sayfuddin is a resident of the region Khuroson. He is 40 years old and married. He has three children. Together with his wife, he works with trade. He owns a sales outlet, where he sells food. 

Sayfuddin takes a loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and food for sale

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Tessie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell for her business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. Thelma has been in this business for six years now.  In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 62 years old, and married with eight children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming sugarcane for 10 years, and also earns additional income from herbal products. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sumiya

texts.en: Sumiya is 21 years old, and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Sumiya runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell. Sumiya has been in this business for three years, and sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods, milk, spices, etc. In the future, Sumiya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old, and married with five children. With two children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.  Susan has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, milk, egg, noodles, bread, etc. 

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so that she could be able to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Музаффар умный и добрый юноша. Ему 25 лет. С помощью отца он открыл свой магазин и последние два года он занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. Отец помогает по бизнесу. Вот теперь он хочет помогать отцу в ремонте дома. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 6000 Сомони для покупки стройматериалов. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muzaffar is smart and kind young man.  He is 25 years old.  He opened his own store with his father's help and has been involved in buying and selling food products for two years.  His father helps him with the business.  Now, Muzaffar wants to help his father with house repairs.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 6000 Somoni to purchase construction materials.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old, and has two children who are in school.  Alona has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Alona has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Alona would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients.

loans.name: Luthgarda

texts.en:
Luthgarda is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 51 years old, and has one child who is in school.

Luthgarda has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.  Luthgarda has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 59 years old, and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Pacita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Pacita has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, snack foods, sugar, noodles, etc. In the future, Pacita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.  Delia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 61 years old, and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Vicenta has a buying and selling of fish business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 53 years old, married and has two children.  She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Lita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lita has been farming rice for 30 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  Ofelia requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant.  She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 53 years old, and married with five children. With one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for her family. Evelyn runs a rice retail business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nemie

texts.en:
Nemie is 45 years old, and married with six children. With two children in school, Nemie works very hard to provide for them.  Nemie runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Nemie has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, milk, shampoo, bread, sardines, etc. In the future, Nemie would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 31 years old, and has a common-law husband with one child. Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 10 years, and also earns an income from fruits and vegetables vending.  Elvira aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from e-loading.  In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Greta is 53 years old, and has two children who are in school. Greta has a balut vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more balut to sell in her food stall.

Greta has been in this business for four years. In the future, Greta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more balut to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending (banana) and fruit farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her bananas. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her bananas.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. With all the children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Marana

texts.en:
Marana is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling fruits and vegetables. Marana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a sari-sari store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more perfumes, body lotion, deodorant and other personal products to sell to customers. Mary Grace hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, body lotion and other personal products.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 44 years old and has 2 children. She is married and has 1 child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Sulayman

texts.ru: Сулайман житель района А. Джоми. Ему 61 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en:
Sulayman is a resident of the region A. Jomi. He is 61 years old and married. He has four children. He earns money by breeding cattle. 

Sulayman takes a loan for the purchase of steers.

loans.use: to purchase steers

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en: Desiree runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, noodles and other groceries. In the future, Desiree would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en: Edeliza is 40 years old, married, and has five children. With 5 children in school, Edeliza works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, sugar, noodles and other groceries. In the future, Edeliza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ma. Concepcion

texts.en:
Ma. Concepcion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling of purified drinking water business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purified drinking water to sell. Ma. Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 39 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Alejandra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is 55 years old, and married with 12 children.  Asuncion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal making business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut shells used for making charcoal. 

Asuncion has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been her business for three years, and also earns an income from general store and pig fattening. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconut shells for business.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 43 years old, and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Candelaria runs a fishing/fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase equipment for her fishing boat.

Candelaria has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, Candelaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 31 years old, and married with two children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.  Emely runs a snack foods vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Emely has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as curls, candy, bread, soft drink, etc.  In the future, Emely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 43 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Esterlita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.  Esterlita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 38 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Evelyn has been raising pigs for six years, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for one year and also earns additional income from frozen products retail.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed for her pigs. Jocelyn is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, Lorina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen operates a shawls sales business to financially support her husband. She sells her shawls to different clothes shops in the market and earns good income. Her shawls are in high demand in her area as well. She sells a variety of shawls to her customers e.g. embroidered, simple and colorful. She makes good embroidery on her shawls, which helps increase her sales and get good profits. 
Her husband has a job that earns a monthly wage. Yasmeen has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her shawls sales business. With the loan investment, she will buy colored thread, beads and colorful shawls in bulk quantity that will allow her to increase her sales and profits. 
She is confident about her success as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy colored thread, beads and colorful shawls for selling.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У них трое детей. Двое его сыновей работают в России. Сам  он занимается изготовлением окон и дверей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 17 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения досок.
texts.en:
Sharif lives in the region Khuroson. He is 48 years old. He is married. They have three children. Two of his sons work in Russia. 

Sharif works with manufacturing windows and doors. He has been engaged in this activity for 17 years. He takes a loan to purchase planks.

loans.use: to purchase planks

loans.name: Tozhimurod

texts.ru: Тожимурод умный и перспективный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством, а он занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозкультур более 10 лет. Раньше он продавал овощи и фрукты на рынке, а потом постепенно сам начал выращивать. В бизнесе помогает ему жена и дети ради улучшения своего жилищного условия. Тожимурод хотел бы получить займ в размере 2000 Сомони для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и мелкого рогатого скота.
texts.en: Tozhimurod is a smart and promising person.  He is married and is a responsible father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker, and he has been involved in growing and selling agricultural crops for ten years.  Tozhimurod previously sold vegetables and fruits at a market and then gradually began to grow them himself.  His wife and children help him with the business for the sake of improving their living conditions.  Tozhimurod wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2000 Somoni to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and small livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and small livestock

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 21 years old and single. He sells health products such as medicine, soap and food supplements to earn a living and has been in the business for one year. Besides that, he owns a mobile phone accessories shop where he also does mobile phone repairs.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become a business-minded person through the trainings he gets from Faulu Kenya on business management. He hopes to expand his business and become financially stable in the future.  He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Piece Group

texts.en:
Maria is in her late thirties and single. She has been selling cosmetics for five years. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. and  is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Marias’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She plans to use it to add more stocks of cosmetics for her business. Maria’s dream is to one day  be able to buy a motorcycle.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group, "Piece", which consists of 16 members who hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to add more stocks of  cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to  increase her stock of chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to put iron sheets on the charcoal store and to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kulnar

texts.ru:
Кульнар 58 лет, замужем, имеет четверых взрослых детей. 
Кульнар родилась в простой семье фермера и с детства помогала родителям по хозяйству. Так получилось, что Кульнар вышла замуж рано в 15 лет. Школу окончила в родном селе, но продолжить учебу у нее не получилось, так как она родила старшего сына. В течении следующих 10 лет Кульнар стала матерью еще троих детей. В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 1980 году, Кульнар устроилась на работу в Каиндинский мясокомбинат в должности бойца (работник, который производит забой скота). Работа была очень тяжелая, но Кульнар сильная женщина, и проработала на мясокомбинате до выхода на пенсию в 2008 году. 
Супруг Кульнар работал пастухом в колхозе имени Панфилова, но после развала Советского Союза колхоз развалился, после чего супруг начал заниматься выпасом скота местного населения. На совместно заработанные деньги Кульнар с супругом обзавелись хозяйством, на доходы от продажи скота выучили детей. В настоящее время, старший сын проживает совместно, и Кульнар заботится о двух внуках. Благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Кульнар, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве одна дойная корова и одна лошадь.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульнар обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых лошадей. Приплод Кульнар планирует продавать.

Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Кульнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее разведение породистых лошадей.
texts.en: Kulnar is 58 years old, married and has four adult children.  She was born into a simple family of a farmer and had helped her parents with the household since childhood.  It just so happened that Kulnar got married early, at the age of 15.  She finished school in her native village, but could not continue her education because she gave birth to her oldest son.  During the next ten years, Kulnar became a mother to three more children.  In search of a source of income for her family, Kulnar got a job as a butcher (worker who butchers livestock) at the Kaindinskiy meat processing plant in 1980.  This work was very hard, but Kulnar is a strong woman and worked at the plant until she retired in 2008.  Kulnar's husband worked as a shepherd at the collective farm, named after Panfilov, but got involved in taking livestock to a pasture for local residents when the collective farm feel apart after the breakup of the Soviet Union.  Kulnar and her husband used their jointly earned money to create a farm business and provided education for their children with earnings from selling livestock.  At the present time, their oldest son lives with them, and Kulnar takes care of two grandchildren.  Thanks to her persistence and love of hard work, Kulnar's business currently has one dairy cow and one horse.  In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase thoroughbred horses.  She plans to sell the offsprings.  Kulnar plans to invest the earning from the business into continued breeding of thoroughbred horses.

loans.use: to purchase thoroughbred horses

loans.name: Manya

texts.en: Manya lives with her son and is engaged in farming. Her son helps her run the farm. Manya has applied for a loan to cultivate the land, and with the loan's help she plans to purchase tomato seeds. Manya hopes she will get a good tomato harvest. She hopes to sell the harvest to get more income. Additional income will help Manya to improve her household's conditions and ensure a better future for her son.

loans.use: to cultivate the land and to puchase tomato seeds.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Sophorn is a construction worker. Kung is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business. 

In addition, the couple also grows rice. They live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have been married since 1985 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren is 51 years old and her husband Chhang is 51 years old. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married for 27 years and have four children: One son and three daughters. One is a driver, two are home attendants and the other one is in school.  

Saren and her husband are farmers. They grow yams, sweet potato and sugar cane on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition, Chhang is also a fisherman. 

Saren is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy additional fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

Photo: Saren is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy additional fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Upendo - Linda Group

texts.en:
Gervas is a 45 year old father of six children. One child is earning a secondary education. He has been working hard for over six years producing coffee, maize and beans. His farming problems are caused by lack of fertilizer and crop diseases. 

Gervas is looking for financial assistance that can be utilized to pay for fertilizers and insecticide for his growing crops. Also he has a target of five years to expand his scale of production from 5 to 10 acres so that he can earn more income that can be used to build better houses, buy food, clothes and cover medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, insecticide, hoes and gum boots.

loans.name: Sokvannara

texts.en:
Sokvannara (in the photo) is 30 year old and her husband, Vit is 29 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two children-one son and one daughter. One child is in school and the other one is still young. The family lives with Vit's mother in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Sokvannara and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, they also raise cows at home. When the cows are fully grown, they will sell them for beef. 

Sokvannara is asking for a loan of $1,200 to assist in her farming business by buying seeds, paying for plow fees and buying additional cows to raise.

loans.use: in her farming business by buying seeds, paying for plow fees and buying additional cows to raise.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is married and has 4 sons and 2 daughters. 2 of them are studying and 2 of them work to financially contribute to the family.

Sughran is a housewife and does her houswork. She is very active and performs her duties very well. She cooks food for the family and keeps her home clean. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who operates an eggs sales business. Eggs sales increase in the winter season because this is an good food item that stays fresh in the cold.
With this loan, he will buy eggs in bulk quantity and will supply them to different grocery shops in the market to earn profits. 
He is relatively new to his business and working very hard. Sughran is hopeful that an investment will help him get established in the business. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran”.

loans.use: To buy eggs for re-selling

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en: Annalie is a married woman with 3 children. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to keep her crops healthy and her farm productive. She has requested this loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. Annalie hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.en: Constantina is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She tills her land to grow rice crops to sell. She works hard to improve her income and her family’s living conditions. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. Constantina is hopeful that this loan will help her achieve a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She tills her own land to grow rice crops to sell. Farming is the main source of income of Juana’s family. Juana does her best to keep her farm productive.

Juana has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will help Juana supply her farm of its needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy an embroidery machine through which she will be able to finish the orders on time and increase her income.
She prepares hand embroidery on dresses which takes a lot of time and effort from her and she wasn’t able to meet the orders on time.  She is hopeful that her work will improve further by purchasing machine and she will be able to finish her orders earlier. 
Her husband works in a vegetable and fruit market and earns reasonable income by selling these products. 
Rozina has given birth to 3 sons and 3 daughters. 3 of them study while the remaining 3 stay at home. 
She has been operating her business for many years and is confident about her success.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for sewing & embroidery business

loans.name: Kiwambi Mapendano Kipegei Group

texts.en:
Angelina is 35 years old and the mother of three children. She has worked hard producing maize, beans and coffee for over seven years. She is facing agricultural problems from lack of fertilizer and crop diseases.

Angelina needs working capital to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. She dreams of boosting her farming activities from 7 to 16 acres in five years to earn more income and be able to pay for a maize milling machine.

In the attached photo, Lusiana is not pictured since she is seriously sick at the hospital suffering from Malaria.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is a married woman living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She has had a sari-sari store business for 9 years. Esmaelita sells items like canned goods, eggs, shampoo and soap. Esmaelita works hard to improve her business and continue supporting her family.

Esmaelita has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as noodles, eggs and canned goods. Esmaelita plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Enhtuul

texts.en: Enhtuul is 37-years-old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is a gold smith and her daughter is a kindergarten student. Enhtuul operates a shoes making business. She started her buriad (Mongolian boots) shoe business in 2004 by selling in the market. She now makes the buriad shoes for children at home. Over the years she became a trusted supplier of many retailers. Now that it's holiday season, her product demand is increasing therefore, she's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy materials.

loans.use: To buy materials to make Buriad (Mongolian) boots.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is a 52-year-old married man who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business for 6 years. Teofilo is able to provide for his family through his business. He requested this loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

In the future, Teofilo hopes to have a progressive business. He also desires for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Ngumbao

texts.en:
Ngumbao is 40-years-old, married and has three children between the ages of 3 to 10. He owns a retail shop and also does farming. He has been in this business for 2 years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he expanded his retail shop. He hopes to see his retail shop and farm grow in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, unga (flour) and a bull.

loans.use: to buy sugar, unga (flour) and a bull.

loans.name: Maqboolan's Group

texts.en:
Maqboolan is an embroidery expert. Her work is home based. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which helps attract many customers towards her.  

She is very dedicated to her work and the reason is she loves doing it. She not only manages her household work and takes care of her family but also gives required time to her work. She is good administrator and manages the household expenses with limited resources.  

Her husband is an electrician by profession. He offers electricity repair services to the clients on demand. 

She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is an ice-cream seller while the other two are studying at a school and others stay at home. 

She has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who is a fruit seller by profession. He has a cart on which he keeps fruit and he visits different areas and streets in order to sell it.  He will invest the loan in order to buy seasonal fruits in large quantities for reselling and generating more revenue. 

He has been operating his business for the past seven years and Maqboolan is hopeful that her brother’s business will improve a lot after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Maqboolan”.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 54-year-old married woman with one child. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 13 years. Marina sells items like soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce, and purified water. Marina earns about 4000 PHP per month with her business.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as sugar, canned goods and soft drinks. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Expeditha

texts.en:
This is Expeditha, 49, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, her business partner, and mother to their four children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Expeditha oversees operations of their "tricycle" transportation business. They have one "tricycle" that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to Expeditha. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Expeditha dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their "Tricycle".

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is a married woman with two children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Russel sells food items to her community. She cooks local delicacies to sell. Russel also deals in Avon products.

Russel requested this loan to purchase ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, and spices. Russel hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables, and spices.

loans.name: Mandakh

texts.en:
Borrower Mandakh is a 50-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a local ger district without basic infrastructure located in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She has operated a shoe selling business but now she supports her family by operating a candy selling business at the second largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

She wants to increase her working capital and improve her business. She is requesting a 2.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more sweets to sell. 

Furthermore, she wants to increase her business profit and make some changes in her current living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more sweets to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 35-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a food vendor. Elvira makes "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick), rice cakes and other local delicacies to sell to her community. Elvira works every day to help meet her family's needs.

Elvira has requested this loan to purchase bananas, cooking oil, sugar and flour. Elvira hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, cooking oil, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 26 year old woman. She lives with her husband and three children. Two of her children study in school while her youngest one is not in school yet. 
Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He has been driving his rickshaw for over 12 years. He provides transport services to passengers by dropping them at their designated places. He is a very good driver. He is very honest and fair and charges his passengers by distance traveled.
She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will repair the engine of his rickshaw because it is causing problems for him while driving. If it doesn’t get repaired soon there is a chance it will get seized. 
Shahnaz is quite hopeful that on time financial support will prove beneficial to her husband’s business and allow him to continue working.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw engine

loans.name: Antik

texts.en: Antik lives in Yerevan with her husband, son and daughter. She trades in fruit and vegetables. Antik has applied for this loan to expand her business. Antik plans to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. This will increase sales and get additional income. This is vital for Antik's family, as she will be able to renovate her house and improve her household's conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is a 61-year-old widow who lives with her son aged 21 in a small apartment in a local district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son works as a chemist at a mining company. 

She has been supporting her family by operating a clothing sale business since 1998 at the second largest outdoor market of Mongolia.  Her business is very popular during all four seasons of the year. 

Tsetsegmaa is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more clothes to sell for the upcoming season. Also, she is a very trusted client of Transcapital Co Ltd.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for the  upcoming season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
