Josephine is a married woman with seven children living in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Josephine buys and resells fruit and vegetables like bananas and sweet potatoes. Josephine earns about 4000 PHP per month with her business.

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell. Josephine hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Shazia Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Shazia Parveen is 26 years old, married and a mother of four children. Two of them are in school while the other two are too young to attend school. 
She is a very supportive lady by nature. She supports her husband in his shoe making business by making shoes. They work with each other so that her husband can finish the orders on time and be able to feed her family.  
Besides this, she completes her household responsibilities very efficiently. She provides comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. She also gives time to her children so they never feel ignored. She is raising them with great care and discipline. 
She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further growth of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, a shoe-polisher and nails in a larger quantity to be able to make more shoes so as to generate more revenue. 
He has almost fifteen years of experience in this work and Shazia is hopeful that the loan investment will bring better profits to his business. 
Note: “One of the members has an embroidery business. That’s why they are showing the embroidered dress”.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails and a shoe-polisher for shoe making business

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 46 years old, married to Ochieng, and they have four children. She has been a tailor for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 14,500.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD of Kes 10,000. She will use the funds to purchase clothing textiles and other sewing materials which she needs in her tailoring shop. She plans to use the anticipated profits to grow her business.

Her hope is to grow her business into a big store and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy textile materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 33 years old, married to John and blessed with four children. She has been a tailor for the last 11 years with a monthly profit of Kenya shillings 8,600.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD of Kes 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase stock of clothing textiles and sewing accessories for her business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to grow the business into a large clothing store.

loans.use: To purchase textile materials and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old, married to John and has five children. She has been operating a second-hand clothes shop and making balls from leather, fabric and paper for the last 11 years. She makes a monthly profit of 13,200 Kenyan Shillings. 
She is applying for her first loan with Kiva partner KADET to buy second-hand clothes and materials for making balls. The profits will be used to expand her business. Elizabeth's dreams are to grow her business into a large retail store and produce balls on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale and materials for making balls.

loans.name: Zerry

texts.en:
Zerry is 23 years old, married and has two children. She has been operating a salon for the last two years. She earns a monthly income of 10,100 KES.
She is requesting her first loan of 20,000 KES with Kiva partner KADET. She will use the loan to purchase beauty accessories for the salon such as weaves, hair oils, hair clips and other items. With her anticipated profits she will expand her business by opening more branches.
Zerry's dream is to provide for her family and expand her beauty salon to several outlets.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and accessories.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, aged 37, is married to Regina and they are blessed with three children aged between 6 and 15 years. He is in the quarrying business and has been in this business for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of 10,000 KES.
This is Benjamin's second loan with Kiva partner KADET. He repaid his previous loan successfully. He will use this loan to buy mining tools and use part of it to buy groceries for his wife's grocery business. Benjamin hopes to start a construction company in the future.

loans.use: to buy mining tools.

loans.name: Tanei

texts.en:
Tanei is 46 years old and married. She has been operating a livestock retail business for the last two years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. This is her first loan with KADET, of 20,000 KES, which she intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to set up a dairy farm.
Tanei's hope is to venture into large-scale dairy farming in her area.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Farhat Naz's Group

texts.en:
Farhat naz is a 30-year-old woman and a talented lady. She owns and operates a boutique business. Her work is home based. She prepares beautiful looking embroidered and stitched clothes and displays them in her boutique to attract customers.  

People of her community come to her for buying dresses. She makes good sales every month. She keeps herself up to date about the latest trends in fashion and that helps her understand her customer’s demands and choices. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her boutique business. She will invest the loan in buying clothes, fiber and embroidery material in bulk to be able to make more new dresses and increase her revenue. She is very confident about the further growth of her boutique business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, fiber and embroidery material for boutique business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, 52, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow and mother of two children. Together with her children, she manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 
Vivian maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct sales brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Vivian's regular customers are her neighbours and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.
To help Vivian continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Vivian fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Né en Janvier 1983 à Sikasso, Monsieur Drissa est marié et réside chez son frère à Kaboïla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Drissa n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, s’est vite initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente de téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) il y a environ trois ans. Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique au grand marché de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout des forains. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Il a bénéficié deux crédits qui ont été correctement remboursés. Dans le but de mieux relancer cette activité, il sollicite ainsi un troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter à Bamako 20 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 3 cartons de façade, 20 chargeurs, 20 paquets de carte mémoire, 5 cartons de batterie et 2 douzaines d’écouteur. 
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in January 1983 in Sikasso, Drissa is married and lives with his brother in Kaboïla II, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Since he did not get a chance to further his education, Drissa quickly got into the business of buying and selling cell phones and phone accessories (covers, batteries, chargers, headphones, etc.) 3 years ago. He does this at his own booth in the big market of Sikassa, with a client base composed of all social classes, but especially itinerant merchants. Because of their quality, the products he sells are in high demand.
In order to better meet the needs of his growing clientele, he decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, about a year ago. He was granted 2 loans, which have been successfully paid back. In order to boost his business, he is applying for a third loan which will enable him to buy 20 phones of various brands, 3 boxes of phone covers, 20 packs of memory cards, 5 boxes of batteries, and 2 dozens of headphones in Bamako.
He expects to make a monthly profit of 200.000 FCFA, which will be mostly used to contribute to his family's expenses, pay back his loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41-years-old single lady. She has been growing mushroom for the last 3 years. 

She is requesting for the first loan from KADET of Kes 30,000. She plans to use the loan to buy farm implements for mushroom growing i.e. organic manure and canvass to extend the dark room for growing mushroom. She plans to use the profits to grow her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to become a exporter of mushrooms.

loans.use: to purchase farm impliments for mushroom growing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy damask, caustic soda, and dye.

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en:
This is Emmie, 42, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Wilfredo, a carpenter, and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emmie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells barbeque for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emmie hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en:
Khadra is a Palestinian woman. She is married with four sons and three daughters. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary.

Khadra wants to complete finishing her house by installing tiles, windows and doors so as to live with her family in better home living conditions, but since her husband's salary is not sufficient to cover these expenses, she needs to take a loan from FATEN.

When Khadra gets the loan, she will be able to pay the expenses for finishing her house and installing tiles, windows and doors. That will allow Khadra and her family to live in comfortable and better house conditions, especially in the winter season. Khadra is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of installing tiles, windows and doors for her house

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
Né  en Mai 1971 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Fousseyni est marié et père de trois  enfants. Il réside avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment aux stockage et commercialisation des céréales, il y a maintenant dix années, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il décida d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il est à son cinquième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
Il compte avec ce cinquième prêt  acheter 20 sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de riz et 25 sacs de mil en provenance dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’être revendues en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de détaillants et de chefs de famille. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Born in May 1971 in Sikasso, Fousseyni is married and is a father of 3. He lives with his wife and children in a large traditional family in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
He never got a chance to go to school and, after a few unsuccessful enterprises, he quickly turned to commercial activites, especially storing and selling cereals, about 10 years ago. He has quite a reputation and gets lots of orders, but he does not have the resources to meet this demand. So, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program through which he is applying for a 5th loan. This loan will enable him to increase his working capital in order to better meet the needs of his customers.
With this 5th loan, he plans on buying 20 bags of corn, 10 bags of rice, and 25 bags of millet from the surrounding communities of Sikasso. These goods are first stored in his store to be sold in wholesale and retail to a clientele of retailers and heads of households.
With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 270 000 FCFA. With the profits, he plans on meeting most of his financial needs and that of his family, paying back his loan, and investing the rest in his main activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is a 27-year-old married woman with no children. Mayasa is a hardworking woman with a good reputation.

Four years ago, Mayasa started selling clothes in her house. Her business is improving a lot with her good customer care and special selling techniques. She used to work as a nurse but since she got married she made her own business.

Mayasa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her winter collection with new releases for her customers.

Mayasa has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles; the last loans reflected positively on her business. Mayasa might use part of the requested loan to undergo the necessary treatments to be capable of being pregnant. She has always dreamed of being pregnant and works hard to make her dream come true.

She hopes to expand her business more and more and at the same time to make a small happy family.

loans.use: to buy a new winter collection.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.en:
Gabina is a 63-year-old married woman with 5 children. She runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. Gabina sells spices, canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar and other various items. Gabina works hard to sustain her family and send her children to school.

Gabina has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, packed noodles, shampoo and soap. Gabina hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, packed noodles, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Serine

texts.en:
Serine lives with her husband and child. The family gets its main income from agriculture: land cultivating and cattle-breeding. Serine would like to increase the number of cattle, as well as cultivate the land. 

With the loan's help she plans to purchase a calf, forage, and flower seeds. Serine will develop agriculture and increase the family's income from meat, milk, and flowers sales. This will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and ensure a better future for them.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, forage, and flower seeds.

loans.name: Alomavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOMAVO est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Christine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Christine est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Sondé. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux à leur charge. Il y a dix ans, Christine mène comme activité la vente de produits cosmétiques et des pâtes dentifrices de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Christine vend des fruits ; ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses différentes charges. Christine achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Christine désire obtenir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOMAVO. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The ALOMAVO group is made up of three people who live in the same district.  The representative of the group, Christine, has her hand raised in the photo.  This is the second time that this group has requested financial assistance through ALIDé with the goal of increasing their business.  Christine is 41 years old and married to Sondé.  The couple has four children, all of whom attend school, and two of which are in their care.  For ten years, Christine has been in the business of selling cosmetic products and toothpaste as a traveling  vendor.  In addition to this, Christine also sells fruit, which helps her to meet different expenses.  Christine buys her products in Bénin.  With the goal of increasing her business activity and to better meet the demand of her customers, Christine would like to take out a second loan through ALIDé, together with the other members of the ALOMAVO group.  The preceding loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Addah

texts.en:
Addah is 30 years old, married to Joshua and has four children. She has been a tailor for the last five years and earns a monthly income of 17,000 KES. She is requesting her first loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy more textiles for making clothes for her customers. With the anticipated profits she will pay school fees for her children and expand her business.
Addah's hope is to grow her business into a one-stop design and clothes-making store.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making clothes.

loans.name: Anushik

texts.en:
Anushik lives in Mrgavet village with her husband and children. She maintains a glasshouse, where she grows flowers.

Anushik is applying for a loan to purchase fuel and to be able to continue growing flowers during the winter months. In this way, the loan will help Anushik to stabilize her business and to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and to grow flowers during the winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber for building

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is a married woman living with her husband and their four children. Her eldest son is involved in the decorative embroidery business, while the other three children are in school.

Decorative embroidery is her family’s main source of income. She, her husband, and her son perform this kind of work to generate revenue. Suraiya and her husband are very experienced in this line of work, so they teach their son about their business so that he can start an independent embroidery business of his own someday to supplement the family's income.

She is requesting a loan to buy more embroidery materials such as beads, lace, colorful threads and clothes so that they can continue to craft beautiful embroidery designs and thereby generate additional profits. They are hopeful about their business’s future financial prospects with the help of the requested loan.

Note: One of the group's members sells sweets, which is why they are holding boxes of sweets.

loans.use: To purchase additional embroidery materials and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil and caustic soda.

loans.name: Les Genies Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LES GENIES est formé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Assana, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Assana est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un certain Kondo. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Assana a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Il y a trois ans, Assana a commencé la vente de produits cosmétiques dans sa boutique. De façon secondaire, Assana vend des produits divers (conserves, etc.). Assana achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Assana désire obtenir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LES GENIES. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Les Genies group is made up of three people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, whose name is Assana, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, so that they can increase their business volume. 

Assana is 26 years old and married to a man named Kondo. The couple has two children, both at school and in their care. Assana left school at primary level. Three years ago she began selling cosmetics in her shop. As a secondary activity Assana sells a variety of other products (canned foods etc.). She buys her products in Benin. With the aim of increasing her stock and responding better to customer demand, Assana would like to obtain a second loan from Alidé together with the other members of the Les Genies group. The first loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two school-age kids in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. Mom and her husband are local rice farmers who have recently finished collecting and threshing their rice. Besides farming, Mom’s husband takes some time to go through the village to buy recycled materials from the villagers and then sells them to its industry for profit. 

Currently, Mom is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva for her husband to keep as capital to buy recycled materials. This loan will sustain and improve this business well. She is very happy and grateful. In the future, she hopes that she’ll be able to rebuild her house again and cover the roof with tiles.

loans.use: to keep as capital to buy recycled materials.

loans.name: Jiendeleze - Ngima Group

texts.en:
Sebastian is a 69-year-old married man with three children. He is good in growing coffee, maize, and beans for over 16 years. He faces farming problems - basically lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

He works to find funds to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He wishes to expand his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
Maliha is a 28-year-old mother of two from the Negev region. She has just an elementary school education but strong determination and drive. Maliha wants to provide for her children and ensure a secure future. She has a business raising chicks and selling them to local customers. In this way, Maliha has been able to contribute to her family’s monthly income.
Maliha is requesting this loan to purchase additional chicks and restructure the area where she raises her chickens. She wants to continue and strengthen her business, eventually expanding so she can sell chickens to the entire area.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicks and restructure the area where she raises her chickens.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old, married to Thomas and has eight children. She has been a tailor for the last 16 years and earns a monthly income of 10,400 KES. This is her first loan with Kiva partner KADET of 20,000 KES. She plans to use the loan to purchase textiles and sewing accessories for use in her tailoring business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and educate her children.
In the future Mary hopes to grow her business in various parts of the country.

loans.use: to buy textiles and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 41 years old, single and has three children. She has been running a food stall selling fish for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of 5,500 KES. She is requesting her first loan with Kiva partner KADET of 20,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of fish for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will expand her business and educate her children.
Everlyne's hopes and dreams are to grow her business to supply fish in the whole locality and educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and spare parts for her sewing machines.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 42 years old, married to Okello and has five children. She has been in the greengrocery business for last 16 years and earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is requesting her first loan of 20,000 KES  from Kiva partner KADET. She plans to use the funds to buy more vegetables for resale such as onions, tomatoes and kale. 
Everlyne plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children to college level and grow her business into a big greengrocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 44 years old, married and has three children. She has been in dairy farming for the past six years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES with Kiva partner KADET. She will use the loan to purchase dairy feed, i.e. hay, molasses, ground feeds, and grow Napier grass to supplement the off-the-shelf feeds. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her children.
Eunice's dream is to grow her dairy farming business to a larger scale and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet, aged 34, is a single mother of two children aged 5 and 15. She has a quarrying business that earns her a monthly income of 12,000 KES. This is Violet's second loan; she has successfully repaid a previous loan. She will use the funds to buy quarrying tools and pay wages to the workers. Violet hopes to start a construction company in the future.

loans.use: to buy quarrying tools.

loans.name: Shaista's Group

texts.en:
Shaista is married and works as a seamstress in her community. She began her business with orders from relatives but now her work is acknowledged by her community members as well. Shaista started this work to financially support her family. She charges from PKR 150 to PKR 200 for each dress. She receives regular orders due to her reasonable rates and quality work.

Shaista's husband is a worker who earns a monthly wage in a private firm. Shaista has four children, all of them getting their education from a local school. With this loan, Shaista will buy a new sewing machine because her current one takes much time to sew a single dress, thus affecting her completion deadlines. Shaista is very confident about the positive financial changes to her business after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy a  new sewing machine

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a 36-year-old mother of six. Originally from Lod, Fatma moved to the Negev when she married at age 16. Fatma is a strong, determined woman. She worked at a bridal salon and has opened a hair and cosmetics treatments salon in her home. She has decided to expand and diversify her business now to include additional sales items such as undergarments. Her salon not only provides treatments and hairstyles but also allows customers to purchase supplies and garments.
Fatma is requesting this loan to expand her stock, purchase supplies and stabilize her business. In the future, she wants to open a bridal centre and raise a happy, healthy family.

loans.use: to expand her stock, purchase supplies and stabilize her business.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en: Saddam is a 22-year-old single man who lives with his father and mother, who are farmers. Saddam is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary,. He wants to help his family prepare for the winter agricultural season by purchasing different types of peas and fodder and paying the expenses for cultivating their piece of land. Since his salary is not enough to cover these purchases and expenses, Saddam will take a loan from FATEN. This loan will enable his parents to get better crops, to compete with others and to increase their sales and the family income, resulting in better living conditions for Saddam and his family.

loans.use: To purchase peas and fodder and to pay expenses for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner, Asasah, for her carpet weaving business. She learned this art from her mother and now she has become very skilful in her work and receives a good number of orders regularly. With this loan investment, she will buy wool, thread and other raw materials for making better quality carpets and increasing her income.

Hamida's husband and her only daughter also work in the family business of carpet weaving. Hamida has been operating her business for many years and is confident that an investment will help make it more profitable.

Note: In the photo, Hamida is holding a book (called Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy wool and thread for her carpet weaving business

loans.name: Ortikoi

texts.ru: Ортикой пожилая женщина 64 лет. Она замужем имеет 8 детей. Муж раньше работал на заводе, теперь он пенсионер разводит дома скот. Сыновья и дочери находятся в России. Её дети помогают материально присылая деньги с России. Она разводит скот в течении 20 лет.  Ей по хозяйству помогают внуки. Сотрудничает с нашей организации около 2 лет. Кредит получает на покупку коз и овец.
texts.en: Ortikoi is an elderly, 64 year-old woman.  She is married and has eight children.  Her husband previously worked at a plant and is now a retiree, who breeds livestock at home.  Their sons and daughters are in Russia.  Ortikoi's children help her financially by sending money from Russia.  She has been breeding livestock for 20 years.  Her grandchildren help her with the household.  Ortikoi has been partnering with our organization for about two years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Mirzoabdullo

texts.ru: Мирзоабдулло мужчина  жена домохозяйка, пенсионерка. Сыновья находятся в России , присылают деньги каждый месяц. Сам Мирзоабдулло является пастухом, он пасет коз, овец  соседей и за каждое поголовье скота он получает определенную плату. Сам разводит скот в течении 35 лет. Этот бизнес является почти основным источником дохода семьи, не считая денежных переводов с России. Каждый воскресный  день он выводит свой скот на продажу и от полученной выгоды покупает молодых овец. Настоящий кредит получен на покупку коз и овец.
texts.en: Mirzoabdullo is a man, whose wife is a homemaker and a retiree.  His sons are in Russia and send money every month.  Mirzoabdullo is a shepherd and takes the neighbors' goats and sheep to a pasture.  He earns a set pay for each livestock head.  He has also been breeding livestock for 35 years.  This business is almost the primary source of income for the family, not counting the monetary transfers from Russia.  Mirzoabdullo takes his livestock out for sale every Sunday and purchases young sheep with the money earned from the sales.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of goats and sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Ukombozi - Mbuji Group

texts.en:
Elgius is a 42-year-old father of five children. He is hardworking in his farming activities, growing maize, coffee and beans for over six years. He is facing agricultural problems such as crop diseases and lack of fertilizers.

Elgius is requesting working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. He has a commitment to expand his farming activities in five years from 6 to 13 acres so as to earn more income to help purchase carpentry equipment and an insecticide pump machine and to cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Hermilina

texts.en:
Hermilina is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband works as a farmer.
Hermilina has run a dress shop in Trinidad, Bohol for 23 years. She not only makes dresses but also sews school uniforms. She earns about 8,000 PHP per month from this business. Hermilina plans to use her loan to purchase cloth, thread and other materials. She hopes to make gowns and buy an additional sewing machine soon.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread and other materials.

loans.name: Guzaloi

texts.ru: Гузалой 41 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находиться на заработках в России. Ежемесячно присылает ей деньги.  Гузалой торгует в магазине продовольственными товарами и продукты питания. Первый кредит получила на расширения ассортимента товара. За это время она купила машину С того времени ее семейное положение улучшилось, она провела летом ремонт в квартире, а сейчас решила обновить свою домашнюю мебель. Сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2009 года. Настоящий кредит получила для покупки мебели для дома.
texts.en: Guzaloi is 41 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works in Russia and sends her money monthly.  Guzaloi sells grocery and food products at a store.  She obtained her first loan for the expansion of product selection.  Since that time, she purchased a car.  Her family situation improved as well since then.  She did repairs in her apartment in the summer and now decided to update her home furniture.  Guzaloi has been partnering with our organization since 2009.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of furniture for home.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for home

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en: Fatima is the mother of two children who are both enrolled in school and getting their education. Her husband works in a private firm for a monthly wage. In order to financially support him, Fatima operates a clothing sales business. She began by going to different shops and communities to sell her clothes but now she has a good reputation among her clients, who give her their orders which she fulfills by visiting different cities. Although she has only five years of experience in her business, her knowledge helps motivate her clients to give her orders. Fatima will invest this loan in expanding her clothing sales business further. She is confident of getting better financial results from her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 31-year-old mother of five from the Negev in southern Israel. She has an after-school and daycare center in her village. She provides excellent care, a loving environment and educational activities for the children in her care.
Sahar is requesting this loan to purchase new toys, kitchen equipment, tables and chairs. 
In the future, Sahar wants to further expand her childcare business, create a more open area and update her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Mrs. Srun, 39, has 3 children who attend school. She earns her living as a greengrocer in her commune in Pre Chor district. She typically buys vegetables from her suppliers and grows them herself as well, yielding an average income of $2 per day. Her husband is also in the same business but he sells in a different area. Srun will use this $700 loan to fix her house which is in disrepair. Her business goal is to expand and satisfy her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 46 years of age. She is married and has two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son is a master tailor. Her two younger children left their education after studying 8th standard and stay at home.

Razia is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has great skills and receives regular orders every month due to her good-quality work.

Her husband operates a scrap-selling business. He provides scrap to other scrap dealers and factories on order. Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a large order to fill. With the loan investment, he will buy scrap in bulk quantity that will allow him to fill the order and increase his profits and income. 

He has been operating his business for many years and Razia is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for him.

loans.use: To buy scrap for a scrap-selling business

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VIVOGBE est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cécile, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Cécile est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un transitaire du nom de André. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cécile a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis dix ans, Cécile vend des chaussures dans un marché du Bénin. Cécile achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Cécile désire obtenir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe VIVOGBE. Le crédit précédent a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Vivogbe group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, whose name is Cécile, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the second time that this group has sought financial aid from Alidé, so that they can increase their business volume. 

Cécile is 41 years old and married to a freight broker called André. The couple has four children who are all at school and in their care. Cécile left school at primary level. For the past ten years she has been selling shoes in a market in Benin. She also buys her products in Benin. With a view to increasing her stock and responding better to customer demand, Cécile, together with the other members of the Vivogbe group, would like to have a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Malik

texts.ru: Малик 1959 года рождения, женат имеет 6 детей. Жена домохозяйка, но помогает мужу  по бизнесу. Она стрижет коз и эту шерсть продает.  В начале весны жена Малика и его невестки стригут ангорских коз, после обработки делают пряжу. В течении года они продают пряжу на рынках города. Сам Малик также работает разнорабочим на стройке. У нас сотрудничает с 2010 года. Первый кредит получил в феврале на покупку коз и овец. Также сыновья работают в России и высылают деньги на проживание. За скотом также  ухаживают невестки, когда он уезжает на работу. Кредит получил на покупку баранов и коз.
texts.en: Malik was born in 1959.  He is married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker, but helps her husband with the business.  Malik shears goats and sells the wool.  His wife and daughters-in-law shear Angora goats at the beginning of spring, then treat the wool and make yarn.  They sell the yarn over the course of a year at the city markets.  Malik also works as a handyman at a construction site.  He has been partnering with us since 2010.  He obtained his first loan in February to purchase goats and sheep.  His sons work in Russia and send money home for living expenses.  Malik's daughters-in-law also help with the livestock when he leaves to go to work.  He is requesting this loan to purchase sheep and goats.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Hamrojon

texts.ru: Хамрочон женщина в возрасте 54 лет , мать двоих детей. Мужа нет в живых. Сама Хамрочон проживает в дальнем районе Джамоата Утконсой. В основном жители данного района занимаются откормом и продажей скота. Её сын сейчас на заработках в России, поэтому Хамрочон живёт вместе с невесткой . На получаемый кредит она собирается купить одну корову и корм для неё, откормив зимой планирует продать подороже и на полученный доход улучшить социальное положение семьи.
texts.en: Hamrojon is 54 year-old woman and a mother of two children.  Her husband has passed away.  Hamrojon lives in the remote Jamoat Utkansoi.  The residents of this district are mainly involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  Hamrojon's son is currently working in Russia, and this is why she lives with her daughter-in-law.  She plans to use this loan to purchase one cow and fodder for it, fatten it up over the winter, sell it at a higher price, and use the resulting profit to improve the family's social standing.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Шарифа 1967 года рождения, замужем, у нее сын и дочь. Муж временно не работает, но в сезон едет в Россию, Посоветовавшись с мужем, решила получить кредит, для покупки скота. Она планирует увеличить поголовье своих коз, и запастись кормом. Она с мужем  купит также жмых и сено на зиму. В свободное время она с дочерью плетут пряжу.
texts.en: Sharifa was born 1967.  She is married and has a son and a daughter.  Her husband is temporarily unemployed, but will travel to Russia during the season.  After talking with her husband, she decided to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock.  Sharifa plans to increase her goat headcount and stock up on animal feed.  She and her husband will also buy seed cake and hay for the winter.  Sharifa and her daughter make yarn in their free time.

loans.use: to purchase goats and stock up on animal feed

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Jitegemezi Ukata Group

texts.en:
Filomon is 58 years old and a father of nine children. He has been growing maize, beans, and coffee for over three years. Crop diseases and lack of fertilizers are problems for his farm.

Filomon spends much time looking for financial assistance to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Also, he has a vision to strengthen his farming activities from 6 acres to 14 acres in the next five years. He expects to earn more income from this growth, which he can use to build a good house, buy a private transport facility, purchase clothes, and cover the medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide and fertilizer

loans.name: Eralboi

texts.ru: Эрали  48 лет, он женат  имеет 3 детей, двое из них в России.  Он разводит скот в течении 20 лет. Этому ремеслу он научился у  отца. В их кишлаке  работу найти трудно, многие  мужчины и женщины уехали на заработки в другие страны. Поэтому скотоводство и выращивание сельхозкультуры является их основным источником доходом. Ее сыновья присылают деньги, но когда сыновья приезжают к ним  домой, тогда  и выручает продажа  коров или коз на рынке. Для поддержания бизнеса ему необходимы деньги, что бы он мог купить коров, тем более в зимний период скот дешевле, чем летом.
texts.en: Erali is 48 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in Russia.  He has been breeding livestock for 20 years.  He learned this business from his father.  It is difficult to find work in their village, and many men and women left to work in other countries.  This is why animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops is their primary source of income.  Erali's sons send money home, but when the sons return home, then selling cattle and goats at a market helps them out.  Erali needs money to support his business, in order to purchase cattle, especially because livestock in cheaper in the winter than in the summer.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en: Mr. Lkhagvasuren, 28, has been working as a taxi driver since last summer and gained much experience from this business field. His job starts at 7 am and finishes at 11 pm at night during the weekdays. Currently, he lives with his wife and daughter in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Recently, he decided to move out to start his own individual life, but he needs a complete ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent with insulation on the walls, before this coming cold winter. Therefore, his loan will be used to cover the payment of a new ger to start his own individual life.

loans.use: to cover the payment of new ger to start his own individual life

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is 35 years old and a widow. She has spent her life in great difficulties since the death of her husband, but she never lost hope.

She has been operating a sewing business and lives with her brother and two daughters. Her brother operates a printing business in the market. He has a printer and charges five rupees per printed page.

Shagufta has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy another printer that will help him offer better printing services to his clients and increase his profits. He is an experienced person and has been operating his business for many years. Shagufta hopes that an investment will help him earn more profits from his business.

loans.use: To buy a new printer for a printing business

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон 1969 года рождения, у него 4 детей. Раньше он работал пастухом в колхозе, в течении 25 лет набрал опыта по разведению скота, сейчас он занялся куплей продажей скота и каждую неделю перепродает коз. Жена также помогает по хозяйству Олиму, у них есть корова и теленок. Она доит корову, а молоко и молочные продукты продает соседям. Олимчон надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество и финансовую поддержку и просит кредит для покупки коровы.
texts.en: Olimjon was born in 1969.  He has four children.  He had previously worked as a shepherd at a collective farm for 25 years and gained experience in breeding livestock.  Now, Olimjon became involved in buying and selling livestock and resells goats every week.  His wife also helps Olim with the business, and they own a cow and a calf.  She milks the cow and sells milk and dairy products to the neighbors.  Olimjon relies on continued partnership and financial support and is requesting a loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Roshni Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Roshni bibi is a married woman who owns and operates a business selling bangles. She is very sensible businesswoman. She sells almost every kind of bangle to her customers and generates revenue. 

She is very kind woman. Besides her business, she also gives the required time to her household work. She is the mother of six children. One of her kids does work while the others are studying. Her husband is a plumber and offers his services to the customers on demand. 

Roshni bibi has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her bangle-selling business. With the loan, she will buy bangles in larger quantity for increasing her sales and profits. 

She is very confident that her business will return her more profits after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy bangles for reselling

loans.name: Les Jardinieres Group

texts.fr:
Mme NATHALIE est la représentante du groupe LES JARDINIERES. Elle est  mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âge 06mois. 01 va  à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes  en charge.

Elle est tisseuse  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au  marché de pissy en ville. Ses clients sont  les Hommes et les Femmes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01balles de fils et 1/2kg de teintures.

 Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagnes tissés.
texts.en:
Nathalie is the representative of the Les Jardinières group. She is married and mother to three children. The eldest child is eight years old and the youngest six months. One of the children goes to school. Nathalie has five dependents.

Nathalie has been a weaver for the past three years and she gets her supplies in the town of Pissy. Her customers are both men and women. She wants to buy a bale of thread and half a kilo of dyes. 

She uses her profits to boost her business and her ambition is to open a large shop selling woven "pagnes" (pieces of decorative West African fabric).

loans.use: to buy one bale of thread and half a kilogram of dyes

loans.name: Togtokhsuren

texts.en:
Mr. Togtokhsuren, 38, is a taxi driver and runs an ice cream bulk in the supermarket. He lives with his family in Kherlen, a boundary town in Mongolia. He has been running his taxi business since last spring and the other business was started in 2006 and his wife responds to it. 

Every month, Togtokhsuren and his wife purchase their groceries, such as ice cream, from Russian and Mongolian food suppliers in Ulaanbaatar. But this time they want to purchase a large amount of ice cream for expanding their sales volume. It is beneficial to their business development in the future. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the ice cream for increasing the working capital.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият 47 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2002 года. С период нашего сотрудничества имеет хорошую кредитную историю Первый кредит получила для покупки сезонного товара детской обуви.  Продавала свой товар на раскладушке  на небольшом участке, платя за небольшой участок определенную сумму как за аренду. Со временем начала расширять свой товарооборот и увеличивать свой капитал. Сейчас она торгует не только детской обувью, но и мужской обувью и одеждой. Рынок который она раньше торговала закрыли и перенесли на новое место. Настоящий кредит получает для закупки теплых мужских курток и ботинок.
texts.en: Hosiyat is 47 years old, married and has four children.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2002 and has had a good credit history over this period of time.  Hosiyat obtained her first loan to purchase a seasonal inventory of children's shoes.  She used to sell her merchandise on a cot in a small space and had to pay a set amount for this space as a lease.  With time, she started to increase her goods turnover and capital.  Currently, Hosiyat sells not only children's shoes, but also men's shoes and clothing.  The market, where she previously worked, was closed and moved to a new location.  Hosiyat is requesting this loan to purchase warm men's jackets and boots.

loans.use: to purchase men's warm jackets and boots

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of fish from her suppliers.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Шоира молодая, энергичная учительница начальных классов, преподаёт в районной школе. Замужем и имеет двух сыновей подросткового возраста. Воспитывает детей сама, так как муж уехал на заработки за пределы города. В школе работает с детьми и заодно имеет кружок по ремесленничеству. Она занимается пошивом национальных мужских ватных халатов (чапанов)и обучает этому ремеслу нескольких учеников. После того как узнала о нашей программе,решила получить кредит и расширить свой оборот, так как имела большой спрос на свои продукции. Сейчас она уже стабилизировала свои обороты и теперь берет кредит на потребительские цели, хочет улучшить свои бытовые условия.
texts.en: Shoira is a young, energetic teacher of primary grades, who teaches at a district school.  She is married and has two teenage sons.  She is raising the children herself because her husband left to work outside the city limits.  Shoira works with children at school and also has craftsmanship club.  She is involved in sewing men's cotton-filled coats (chapans) and teaches this trade to several students.  After learning about our program, Shoira decided to obtain a loan and increase her turnover because she had a high demand for her products.  Now that she stabilized her turnover, Shoira is requesting this loan for consumer needs in order to improve her household conditions.

loans.use: to buy household appliances

loans.name: Chulduzoi

texts.ru: Чулдузой 43-летняя замужняя женщина со средним образованием, воспитывает 4-х детей, дома занимается обработкой шерсти и вязанием шерстяных и зимних изделий на продажу. Её муж - Чори, занимается откормом скота и постоянно держит скот, это его основной доход. Скот пасёт на пастбище и целый год они питаются горными травами. Среди его скота он также держит ангорских коз, чья шерсть очень дорогая, и считается дополнительной прибылью в семейный бюджет. В период работы с нашей организацией она намного улучшила свои дела и привлекла своих знакомых к нам. Новый кредит она хочет потратить на покупку нескольких коз.
texts.en: Chulduzoi is a 43 year-old married woman with secondary education.  She is raising four children and is involved in processing wool and knitting wool and winter goods at home for sale.  Her husband, Chori, is involved in fattening up livestock and regularly keeps goats, which is his primary source of income.  The livestock grazes at a pasture and eats mountain grass throughout the year.  He also keep several Angora goats among his livestock, whose wool is very expensive, and this brings in an additional profit to the family budget.  During the period of working with our organization, Chulduzoi has significantly improved her business and referred her friends to us.  She wants to spend this new loan on the purchase of several goats.

loans.use: to purchase several goats

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is married and the mother of 5 children: three of whom are in school. Rubina is a very caring lady. She spends her time at home and completes her household responsibilities. She takes care of her family by fulfilling their needs. She is raising her children with great care and discipline so they become good citizens and make their parents proud. 
Rubina’s husband is a talented businessman. He is a blacksmith by profession. He makes and sells iron boxes which are used to store items such as clothes, quilts and blankets. This is a very popular and necessary item for a house.  
He has 10 years of experience in his work. 
Rubina has requested for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. He will invest the loan in buying of iron and nails in larger quantity to make iron boxes to sell. 
She is hopeful that her husband will make positive use of the loan which enables him to meet his orders on time and generate more revenue.

loans.use: To buy iron and nails for iron box making business

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila has requested a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her sewing business.

She sews clothes for her community clients. She is very skillful and her clients like her work very much and give her regular orders every month. With the loan investment, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders on time and increase her income.

Her husband sells clothes and operates his business from a little shop in the market. 

Jamila has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Her daughters remain at home and help Jamila in her household work, while both sons work as laborers.

She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that an investment will be helpful for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin lives with her husband and daughters. She is engaged in agriculture. Besides agriculture, Angin runs a little bakery, where she makes and sells bread. 

Angin has applied for a loan to cultivate her land and develop her bakery. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase seeds and flour. This loan will help Angin to develop her farming, as well as increase the production in the bakery. 

Angin hopes she will develop the bakery and create jobs for members of the community in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and flour.

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Rasmiya

texts.en: Rasmiya, a 57-year-old woman, is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Rasmiya has a small grocery store, established five years ago in the place where she lives, which helps her pay for life expenses. Rasmiya wants to buy a new fridge for keeping frozen food to resell in her store, but since her income is low and her husband's salary is not sufficient to cover this purchase, she needs a loan from FATEN. When Rasmiya gets the loan, she will be able to improve her grocery store and buy more frozen food to resell. This will increase her sales and increase her income positively. Rasmiya appears in this photograph.

loans.use: to purchase a fridge for keeping frozen food.

loans.name: Sabeeha's Group

texts.en:
Sabeeha is 52 years old, married, and has three sons. Her eldest son operates a clothing sales business, while the other remains at home and is currently looking for work. 

Her husband sells fruit. He always provides fresh seasonal fruit to his customers for low rates and earns reasonably good profits from his business. Sabeeha is a housewife; she stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy clothes in bulk quantity and in a greater variety, which will allow him to make more sales and increase his income. He has been operating his business for the past many years and Sabeeha is confident of his business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk for a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Muniran is a 57-year-old woman. She spends her time at home and fulfills her household responsibilities. She is a very caring woman by nature. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Muniran’s husband is a very good painter. He gets work on a contract basis and gets a good profit at the end of contract. Muniran is the mother of three children: two daughters and a son who are 32, 25, and 20 years old. Muniran has given them a good education and now her first daughter and son are financially contributing to the family with their work. Her elder daughter is a teacher in a school, and her son runs a medical store and sells medicines.   

Muniran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy medicines in larger quantity to put in his medical store for resale. Muniran hopes that her son's business will be improved a lot after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Muniran.

loans.use: To buy medicines for medical store business

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en: Nunufar lives in Yerevan with her husband and two sons. For fifteen years Nunufar has been trading meat products from a rented booth in the city market. Nunufar is a very hard-working woman and with her work, as well as her husband's support, she has developed her business and made a stable basis for its expansion. With the loan's help, Nunufar plans to increase her inventory. This will allow her to earn more income and ensure a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for meat products.

loans.name: Karimatou

texts.fr:
Karimatou est une femme âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur de taxi moto. Elle a 1 enfant.
Karimatou travaille comme tresseuse depuis 2003. Elle tresse essentiellement les femmes et vend des mèches, des tissages et des oreillers dans son salon de coiffure. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Karimatou a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des tissages et des oreillers. Elle veut réinvestir une partie des bénéfices dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Karimatou voudrait ouvrir un atelier plus grand. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Karimatou is a 30-year-old woman. She is married to a mototaxi driver. She has one child.
Karimatou has been working as a hair braider since 2003. She braids mostly women's hair, sells extensions, weaves, and cushions in her salon. She buys her supplies at the big market in Lomé. She works alone. For the moment, her business is ok.
Karimatou is applying for this first loan from WAGES in order to buy hair extensions, weaves, and cushions. She wants to reinvest part of the profits into her business.
In the coming years, Karimatou would like to open a bigger salon. With the profits, she intends on taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her garment-selling business. She makes T-shirts and other garments and sells them at different garment shops in the market. She has good business skills and receives regular orders because of her good quality work. She has been operating her business for many years and is hopeful that a loan investment will help her make more profits from her business.

Rukhsana's husband has a furniture manufacturing and selling business. She is the mother of four daughters and a son. The two eldest children work while others remain at home. Besides her business, Rukhsana also performs her household duties very well.

Note: In the photo, the woman holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her garment-making and selling business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur. Elle a 5 enfants.
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des gâteaux( des beignets faits à base de farine de blé cuit dans de l'huile végétale) pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Adjo a requis son 2nd crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la farine de blé. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Adjo voudrait ouvrir boutique pour vendre d'autres marchandises. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to a pastor. She has 5 children. Adjo has been selling things since 2008. She sells cakes (donuts made from wheat flour cooked in vegetable oil) to customers at her house. She buys the products from Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she doesn’t have any difficulties. Adjo has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to buy wheat flour. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Adjo would like to open a shop to sell other items. She says that with her profits, she will take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of hibiscus flowers, cans of dyes of various colors, flavoring, bags of sugar

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 27 year old woman. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He has also worked in agriculture for the past 4 years in order to increase the family income. 

Laila wants to help her husband and share the expenses of purchasing a water tank to irrigate the crops. Because her husband's salary is not sufficient to cover the family daily expenses and the purchase of a water tank, Laila needs to take a loan from FATEN in the amount of $2,000. Taking this loan will enable her to share the expense of purchasing a water tank that will help to irrigate crops well so the family will have better crops and increase their sales. This will also increase the family income and offer the family better living conditions. Laila is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to irrigate crops.

loans.name: Tasleem Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem Kosar is a 30 year old woman involved in the sewing business. Her work is home based. She does this work to financially support her husband. She is a very talented woman. She sews dresses with perfect measurement. Her clients are very satisfied with her performance and they give her regular orders every month. 

Her husband and her brother-in-law are involved in a dairy business. They have buffaloes at home from which they get milk and earn income. Earlier, they worked together but now her brother-in-law has started his dairy business independently. Her husband taught him and guided him a lot in this business and feels happy to see him working with great dedication.
 
Tasleem Kosar has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the growth of her brother-in-law’s business. He will use the loan to buy a buffalo to get milk for reselling. She is hopeful that he will be established with his business after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Tasleem Kosar”.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for the dairy business.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.ru:
Zeynab zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Bala Bakhmanli vmeste so sovyey semyoy. Zeynab 44 qoda. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari dlya prodaji v svayom magazine. Zeynab 5 let nazad otkrila etot maqazin qde prodayet mnogo raznix tovarov dlya domashnego upodrebleniya( nojnicci, lampi, tarelki i t.d)
texts.en: Zeynab is married and has one child.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives with her family in the Bala Bakhmanli village in the Fuzuli region.  Zeynab is 44 years old.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to purchase merchandise for sale at her store.  Zeynab opened this store, where she sells many different goods for home use (scissors, lamps, plates, etc.), five years ago.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for sale

loans.name: Zoxra

texts.ru: Zoxra 58 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona yavlyayetya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Kurdmakhmudlu vmeste so sovim mujem i detmi. Zoxra uje 7 let kak imeyet svoy magazin gde prodayet pisheviye produkti. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoy magazi dlya razmesheniya bolshe nujnix tovarov.
texts.en: Zoxra is 58 years old, married and has three children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives with her husband and children in the Kurdmakhmudlu village in the Fuzuli region.  Zoxra has had her store, where she sells food products, for seven years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN to expand her store in order to fit more needed products.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school, located in Blama village, near Kenema City in Eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves 60 pupils and employs 6 teachers. In operation since 1990, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.

However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side-projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries.

Elizabeth is the leader of this group of teachers. Elizabeth is 49 years old and has been in the teaching profession for 27 years. She is married, and together they have four children – one in primary school, two in secondary school and one in college. Elizabeth plans to use her portion of the loan to buy house building materials, like cement and nails, for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cement and nails for the construction of a house

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera, 42, is the mother of six sons and three daughters. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary.
 
Sameera has a sewing workshop and wants to improve the quality of her work by purchasing a new sewing kit. Since the income she gets from her workshop is low and is not enough to cover the purchase of a new sewing kit, Sameera needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When Sameera gets the loan, she will be able to cover the amount of purchasing a new sewing kit and that will help her to improve the quality of her work positively. This will lead to an increase in her sales and her income, so she will create better living conditions for her family. 

Sameera and her son Qassam are photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing kit.

loans.name: Makhbuba

texts.ru: Makhbuba yavlyayetya IDP perssonom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Makhbuba 48 let. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit jesnkuyu odejdu osobenno vecherniye platya dlya prodaji. Ona uje 4 qoda kak imeyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji jenskoy odejdi.
texts.en: Makhbuba is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and currently lives with her family in the Makhmudlu village in the Fuzuli region.  She is 48 years old, married and has two children.  Currently, Makhbuba needs 2000 AZN to purchase women's clothing, especially evening dresses, for sale.  She has had her own store, where she sells women's clothing, for four years already.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing for sale

loans.name: David M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school, located Kenema City, in Eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves 219 pupils and employs eight teachers. In operation since 1985, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.

However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side-projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries. This group of teachers has thus applied for a loan of 4,700,000 Sierra Leonean Leones from SMT/Kiva lenders.

David is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 47 years old and has been in the teaching profession for 14 years now. He is married, and together they have four children – one in primary school and three in secondary schools. David plans to use his portion of the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Seda

texts.en: Seda is engaged in agriculture. She keeps cattle and cultivates land. Seda lives with her husband and daughter, who help her to run the farm. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, and it's barely enough to cover daily costs. Seda has applied for this loan to develop her farm. She plans to purchase seeds for cultivating and forage for the cattle. By developing her agricultural activities, Seda will get more income and insure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and forage

location.town: Nor Ughi village of Ararat region

loans.name: Bundu's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school located in Boijibu village, near Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves 411 pupils and employs ten teachers. In operation since 1974, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.
However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side-projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries. This group of teachers has applied for a loan of 11,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders.
Bundu is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 53 years old and has been in the teaching profession for 13 years now. He is married and has six children – two are in primary school, one is in secondary school and one is in college; the others are no longer attending schools. Bundu has requested this loan in order to purchase a piece of land for the future construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for the future construction of a house for his family

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Gulshan nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy tovar(moyushiye sredstva )dlya prodaji. V svayom magazine ona prodovala tolka pisheviye produkti no seychas ona xochet prodovat i moyushiye sredstva tak kak sredi pokupateley yest spros na eti tovari. Gulshan zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona yavlyayetya IDP perssonom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so sovim mujem i detmi. Gulshan 32 qoda. Ona uje 6 let imeyet etot magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov.
texts.en: Gulshan needs 2000 AZN to purchase new merchandise (cleaning solutions) for sale.  She sold only food products at her store, but now wants to also sell cleaning solutions because these goods are in demand among customers.  Gulshan is married and has three children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives with her husband and children in the Fuzuli region.  Gulshan is 32 years old.  She has had this food store for six years.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning solutions

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma lives in Nor Dvin village with her husband and two children. She keeps cattle and cultivates land. Emma would like to develop cattle breeding, for which she needs sufficient financial means. Emma plans to purchase a calf as well as to pay for renovation of the barn. Development of agriculture will allow Emma to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and renovation of the barn

location.town: Nor Dvin village of Ararat region

loans.name: Sakinakhon

texts.ru: Сакинахон жительница города Исфары. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Сакинахон занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает конфеты. Этим видом деятельности занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для покупки шоколада и конфет. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара, так как перед праздниками спрос на ее товар увеличивается.
texts.en: Sakimnakhon lives in the city of Isfary. She is 43 years old, is married, and has one child. Sakimnakhon is a merchant at the market. She sells sweets. She has been engaged in this type of work for 18 years. She is requesting a loan to buy chocolate and sweets. She wants to increase the variety of goods that she sells, as the demand for her products increases before the holidays.

loans.use: To buy chocolate and sweets

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is 33 years old. She is a mother of four children, and all of them go to school. She has been running a business of selling peanuts for the period of three years. With the loan, she will buy more peanuts to sell. She will use the profits to pay school fees and provide for the family. She would like to own a vehicle that would ease her business.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 34 years old. She has four children, all of whom attend school except the youngest. She is married to a businessman. 

She has spent four years running a market business. She expects to use the loan to buy more market items such as rice, sugar, and maize flour to sell. She plans to save the profits as well as paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, sugar and maize to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 41 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 3 and 17; all of them go to school. Her husband works as a farmer. With the loan, she will buy more sorghum to make the local beer; she has been in the business for the past 26 years as a farmer but most especially she grows sorghum. She expects to use the profits to pay school fees for the children and to save for the better future of the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Raniya

texts.en:
Raniya (pictured above) is a 23-year-old young woman. She is married with no children yet. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary.
