Raniya has had a project of raising sheep since two years ago. It is a beneficial project, as she sells the sheep products to the public and stores in the area where she lives. Raniya wants to expand her project by purchasing more numbers of sheep, so as to benefit more from selling their products and increase her income. But, since her husband's salary and her income are low and not enough to pay for the sheep, Raniya needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

Getting this loan will enable Raniya to expand her project and increase her sales and her income. She will depend more on herself and that will give her more self confidence.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 30 years old and married to a businesswoman. He has four children aged between 2 and 13; all are enrolled in school. 

He sells different items such as rice, beans and soaps in the shop that he has been running for the period of seven years. With the loan, he will buy more rice and beans to sell. Emmanuel plans to use the profits for savings, to pay school fees for his children and to provide food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 28 years old. She is married to a driver. They have two children aged 1 and 8. She has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell, such as bananas. With the profits, she will pay school fees for her children and renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jean  Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 41 years old and the father of two children who both go to school. 

He has been running a boutique for the past eight years. With the loan he will buy more items to sell in the boutique like rice, soaps and sugar. With the profits from the business, he will pay school fees for his children and make savings.

He would love to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 31 years old. He has three children between the ages of 2 and 7. Two of his children go to school. 

Jean Bosco has been running a food business for three years. He has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to make savings and pay school fees for his children. He would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old married with one child who is 3 years old. His wife works as a businesswoman. 

Joseph has owned a boutique for six years. With the loan, he will add more items in his boutique such as rice, salt, cooking oil and lotions to sell. 

He plans to use the profits from the business to renovate the house and make savings. He would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, salt, cooking oil and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans, cassava and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 43-year-old widow. She has two children living with her. She started a business selling rubber footwear about 11 years ago, when her business capital was only 150 manats.
For the first time, she took a loan of 600 manats from VisionFund Azercredit to increase her goods. Now, Sakina wants to obtain 1,600 manats to buy children's rubber footwear to sell for the winter season. Her desire for the future is to increase her number of customers. Sakina is a hardworking and reliable woman. She thanks you for helping people with their needs.

loans.use: To buy children's rubber footwear to sell for the winter season.

loans.name: Maxrug

texts.ru: Maxrug 37 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Maxrug yavlyayetya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoim lubimim mujem i detmi. Ona uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya  uvelicheniya kolichestva i razvitiya biznessa.
texts.en: Maxrug is 37 years old. She is married and has two children. Maxrug is a displaced person, a migrant from the city of Fuzuli. She now lives in the settlement of Makhmudu in the Fuzuli district together with her husband and children. She has been raising chickens for 8 years. She needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy chickens to increase her flock and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Mohamed I.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Thirty-five-year-old Mohamed is the leader of this group of teachers. Mohamed was born in a place call Benduma Jewai. He is married and has 10 children, five in primary school and five in secondary schools. Mohamed is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for more than 10 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and invest the rest in business. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Arevabuyr village with her husband and two children. She has been engaged in agriculture for more than 13 years. 

Susanna has applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds. Susanna keeps a greenhouse, which is where she plans to plant the seeds. Susanna hopes she will have a good harvest of potatoes, which she will use to sustain her family as well as sell for additional income.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 40 years old, married to Janet and has two children.

He has been a welder at Kapsabet trading center for 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Ben has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd. as his third  loan after repaying the previous one successfully. He plans to use this amount to purchase welding rods and welding gas for his workshop. He plans to plow back the profits to improve the business that his wife is operating and also to repay the loan.

His dream is to educate his children to greater heights.

loans.use: To purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of livestock

loans.name: Liliana Maria

texts.es: La señora Liliana María a sus 35 años se dedica a la fotografía desde hace dos años, cuando montó en su casa su estudio fotográfico. Desde entonces a captado una gran cantidad de clientes gracias su trabajo de buena calidad, con lo que ha podido aportar a los gastos del hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Con el objetivo de incrementar la capacidad de su negocio y poder atender así más clientes en su estudio fotográfico, la señora Liliana María requiere de la compra de luces para su estudio fotográfico.
texts.en: Liliana Maria, 35, began been working as a photographer 2 years ago, when she set up a photography studio in her house.  Since then, she has attracted a large number of customers thanks to the good quality of her work.  With this business, she has been able to contribute to the household expenses, where she lives with her husband and their two children.  Liliana Maria needs to buy lights for her studio; this will increase her ability to work and will allow her to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy lights for her photography studio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bees

loans.name: Dainel S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org with headquarters in Makeni city in Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will then repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayment to SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Dainel is the leader of this group of teachers. Dainel is 51. He is married and has two children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Dainel has been in the teaching profession for 29 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials for the construction of a family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more milch cows.

loans.name: Landrada

texts.en: Landrada is 31 years old. She is married with five children between 2 and 8; two of them attend school. She sells different products and she has been running this business for the period of 10 years. With the loan, she will add more new items such as sugar, rice and biscuits to sell. She expects to use the profits to buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Khardiata

texts.fr: Khardiata est une femme mariée âgée  de 28 ans. Elle vit dans une des communautés villageoises du Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant de 2 ans. Elle est propriétaire d’une pirogue depuis plus d’un an. Elle a confiée l’exploitation et la gestion a son frère  avec qui  elle  partage les bénéfices. Ce sont les difficultés de la vie qui l’ont   influencé  a choisir une    telle activité.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est  son aspect lucratif . Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de caisses qui  sont utilisées pour la conservation des   poissons  et  filets  de pêche. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et  d’améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en: Khardiata is a married woman who is 28 years old. She lives in one of Senegal's village communities. She is mother to one child who is two years old. She has owned a pirogue for more than a year and has entrusted the operation and management of the pirogue to her brother, with whom she shares the profits. The difficulties of life led her to choose this activity and it is the profitable aspect of it which interests her most. She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since October 2010 and she is requesting a loan of 75,000 francs to buy crates which will be used to conserve fish and fishing nets. This loan will allow her to develop her business more easily and to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy crates for conserving fish and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en:
Gharam is a 21-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only one child. Her husband is the one responsible for covering their life expenses. 

She started to work as a tailor from her home in 2009. In parallel, she has been working in a local company for the past four years. Today, she’s requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added tailoring tools, which will allow her to increase her production. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring tools.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: Gabriel de 32 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 9 años; allí tiene un taller de ebanistería , actividad que aprendió mientras trabajaba en un negocio, con estas mismas características, durante 10 años, para 5 años después independizarse y comprar sus propias  sus herramientas y maquinarias e iniciar su microempresa de la cual vive él y su familia. Su meta mas adelante, es tener una máquina industrial  y trabajar especialmente las puertas,  para distribuirlas semanalmente a través de vendedores. En su taller trabaja muchas líneas, como camas, comedores, estantería etc; En el taller de Gabriel, sus clientes mandan a hacer sus productos y le dan un porcentaje del precio del producto, para que éste de inicio a su trabajo. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo, es insuficiente para lograr incrementar su negocio y responder a su clientela en las épocas de mayor rotación de los productos que Gabriel vende. Esta es la razón por la cual se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materias primas e insumos con su primer credikiva, que es también el primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización; con este inversión logrará hacer nuevos diseños y exhibirlos en su taller.
texts.en: Gabriel is 32 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with his companion and their three children ages 1 to 9.  There he has a cabinet maker's shop, an activity that he learned while working in a business with these same characteristics. He worked with the previous business for 10 years, and has been independent for five years, having purchased his own tools and machines to start his own micro business, which is how he and his family live now.  His future goal is to have an industrial machine and to work particularly on doors in order to distribute them weekly via vendors.  In his shop he works on many different pieces, including beds, dining room tables, shelves etc.  In Gabriel's shop, his clients order products and give him a percentage of the price of the product so that he can get started on his business.  Currently his capital is not sufficient to be able to grow the business and to respond to the needs of his clientele in the periods of highest sales for his products.  For that reason he approached Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, a Kiva field partner, in order to buy raw materials and agricultural products with his first Kiva loan.  This is also the first financing that he has done with this organization.  With this investment he will succeed in making new designs and exhibiting them in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and agricultural products

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 26-year-old young man. He is single and lives with his parents. His father is a worker with a decent salary. Fadi wants to share with his parents the expense of making repairs to the house such as changing tiles, changing windows and doors, installing lights, etc. 

Because his father has a decent salary, which is not enough to pay for these repairs, Fadi needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Fadi to share with his family the expenses needed to repair the house, which will offer to Fadi and his family better home living conditions. 

Fadi is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for repairing the house

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is a 45-year-old man. He’s married and lives in Lebanon with his wife and four children, one of whom is working and three others are still attending school. He has been working as a constructor since 1980 and has his own projects and customers. He’s an expert in his field and is looking to further grow his business. 

Today, he needs to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his children’s study fees. This Kiva loan will allow them to continue their education and achieve good positions. In the future, he plans to develop his business more to be a good support for his family.

loans.use: to pay his children’s study fees.

loans.name: Rosa Cecilia

texts.es:
Rosa de 36 años, tiene una pequeña tienda, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, vive con su esposo y tres hijos en el suburbio de Guayaquil zona caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Debido a que se caso muy joven y su situación económica no era tan buena ella invirtió  sus ahorros en víveres de primera necesidad para tener su propia tienda. Comenzaron la tienda con algunos víveres y a pasar más tiempo con ayuda de su hijo ayer y esposo pudieron surtirla. En la actualidad tiene en su tienda con lácteos, frutas, granos, bebidas etc. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h30. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, enlatados, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener una tienda más grande para asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old, she has a small general store, she lives with her husband and three children and they live in the suburb of Guayaquil, an area known for housing many small business owners. 

Since she married very young and her economic situation was not very good, Rosa invested her savings in basic necessities in order to open up her own store.  They began the store with some basic food items and over time with the help of her son and her husband they were able to stock the store.  Currently she has a general store with dairy products, fruit, grains, drinks etc.  She works from 6:30am to 8:30pm.

With the loan Rosa wants to buy rice, canned goods, and drinks for her store.  In the future she wants to finish building her house and to have a larger store in order to ensure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and canned goods

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El señor Luis Carlos con 62 años, se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y abuelos. Enfocado en la producción de tomate de aliño, ha sacado adelante a su esposa y 3 hijos y ha podido construir su vivienda con gran esfuerzo. Con el objetivo de comprar insumos necesarios para su cosecha como fungicidas y fertilizantes, el señor Luis Carlos busca incrementar su producción con una mayor calidad y poder brindarles un valor agregado a sus clientes que se verá reflejado en el precio de su producto.
texts.en: Señor Luis Carlos, aged 62, has worked for most of his life in agriculture, which he learnt from his parents and grandparents. He is focused on the production of tomato dressing. This activity enabled him to bring progress to his wife and their three children and with great effort he could build their home. By buying agricultural supplies for his crops, such as fungicides and fertilizers, Luis Carlos aims to increase his production through higher quality in order to provide added value to his customers, which will reflect in the price of his product.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as fungicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tafuta Upate Group

texts.en:
Apolonia, is in her early forties and is married with three children.  She   has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 6am to 10pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Apolonia’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of food and pay the school fees for her children and has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to add more stock of food to sell.  Apolonia’s dream is to one day build her own house.

Apolonia will share this loan with her loan group, "Tafuta upate", which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to add more stock of  food to sell.

loans.name: Maria Natali

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad, la joven Maria Natali se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos en una finca familiar desde hace un año, gracias a la oportunidad que le dio un hermano para que utilizara un espacio disponible para que lo adecuara y construyera la vivienda para los cerdos. La joven Maria Natali es madre de 3 hijos de 7,5 y 4 años de edad, quienes requieren de muchos cuidados y gastos de sostenimiento, por lo cual necesita ampliar la vivienda de los cerdos (cochera) y comprar varios cerdos, con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y así poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en: At the young age of 22, María Natalí breeds and sells pigs at her family farm. A year ago, her brother gave her the opportunity to use an empty space, which she adapted to the construction of a pigpen. The young María Natalí is the mother of three children, aged 7, 5 and 4, who require much care and bring about high living expenses. This is why she needs to expand her pigpen and buy several pigs, hoping to increase her sales and thus provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to expand the floor and the roof of her pigpen and to buy several pigs.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla, 42 years old, is the mother of three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a worker earning a low income. For the past 5 years, Khawla has been making embroideries for sale. She wants to bulk purchase missing textiles and threads necessary to make embroideries for resale, but the family income is low and not enough to cover these expenses. Khawla needs to take a loan from FATEN to purchase these materials to continue her work as she has a lot of customer requests for her embroideries. This loan will enable her to increase her embroideries and her sales, which will improve her income and offer better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase textiles and threads.

loans.name: Rashed

texts.en:
Rashed is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man living with his only parent and three working siblings. They are all cooperating together in order to satisfy the family needs. Despite his young age, he was capable to start his own work as a farmer in 2007, and has already seven years of experience in this domain. 

Today, he’s in need of $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new agricultural supplies. This loan will improve his productivity, and therefore his revenues and his way of living. In the future, he plans to open his own fruits and vegetables shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and new agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 36 years old. She is married to a farmer. She sells bananas, and she has been running that business for the period of 20 years. She wants a loan to upgrade her business as well as to add more bananas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 53 years old. She has one child, aged 11. Her husband works as farmer. She has sold foodstuffs for the period of 20 years. With the loan, she will buy more foodstuffs, most especially bananas. With the extra profits, she will buy a bicycle for helping with transportation and distribution in the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 21 years old and single. She sells foodstuffs, and she has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the profits, she will reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old, married to Richard, and they have two children. She she has been running a retail shop for the last eight years earning a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She is requesting a second loan from KADET Ltd of 35,000 KES to buy more stock of wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil. With the anticipated profits she will save to expand her business. 

Her hope is to own a wholesale store and supply goods to the neighboring markets.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Luis Eduardo a sus 48 años es viudo y tiene a su cargo un hijo de 13 años. Se dedica a la confección, actividad que ejerce desde hace 5 años cuando aprendió a través de un curso. Sueña con tener un gran negocio y poder generar empleo para toda la población de bajos recursos, por lo que inicialmente requiere de la compra de insumos para su taller como telas e hilos y ampliar los productos ofrecidos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Señor Luis Eduardo, age 48, is a widower and cares for his 13 year old son.  He is engaged in sewing, a business he has carried on for 5 years and which he learned through a course.  He dreams of having a large business and being able to provide employment to people with few resources.  Initially, he needs to purchase raw materials for his workshop such as fabric and thread so that he can increase the products offered to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread and fabric.

loans.name: Orquidea Lourdes

texts.es:
Orquídea, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 4 años de edad, tienen casa propia, ella tiene esta venta de ropa desde hace tres años, lo heredo de su abuela, ha ganado experiencia y cuenta con clientela.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, blusas, faldas, camisas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, y más productos que sean necesarios para el buen vestir de los clientes, esto incrementara el inventario y le ayudara para crecer y tener mejores ventas.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, ya que este le ayudara para generar más ganancias para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Orquídea sells clothing for a living.  She lives with her husband and 4 year old child.  They have their own house.  She has been selling clothing for three years, a business she inherited from her grandmother.  She has experience and she has a customer base.  Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, undergarments and other products that are necessary for her customers to be well-dressed.  This will increase her inventory and help her to grow and increase her sales.  Her goal is to strengthen her business as this will help her to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, pants and undergarments.

loans.name: Urbanos

texts.en:
Urbanos is 42 years old, married, and has three children aged four, 11, and 15. He sells shoes to earn a living, a business he has done for seven years. He also does farming. He describes his business environment as competitive due to the existence of many people doing the same type of business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income. He hopes to educate his children and expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 42 years old and widowed with two children aged 18 and 22. She sells groceries to earn a living. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her grocery business in the near future. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots and tomatoes

loans.name: Raghad

texts.en:
Raghad is a 20-years-old young woman. Her husband has a job with a decent salary. To improve his income he works in agriculture. Raghad wants to help her husband by paying the expenses for purchasing greenhouses to use for the winter agricultural season.  Since her husband's salary is not enough to pay the family's daily life expenses and to purchase greenhouses for agricultural use, Raghad needs to take a loan from FATEN to help her husband in paying for the greenhouses. 

When Raghad gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband improve his agriculture and prepare to grow better crops to increase his sales and subsequently increase the family's income and offer to them better living conditions. Raghad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for purchasing new greenhouses for agriculture use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 39 years old and is married with two children aged 15 and 18. He owns a medium size primary school. His wife is a primary school teacher. He has been in this business for 6 years.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to purchase office furniture. He hopes to expand the school classes and to enroll more pupils in the future. He has applied for 50,000 KES to purchase more desks and to renovate the classrooms.

loans.use: to purchase more desks and to renovate the classrooms.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es: Cynthia de 24 años, aprendió por tradición a elaborar con sus propias manos el oficio de artesanías, su tía se dedicó a enseñarle y ella ahora teje mochilas, hamacas, bolsos, sombreros sandalias, vestidos y cuanto diseño se le ocurre. Con las técnicas en crochet y punto ganchillo y de telar vertical ha salido adelante; ella vende sus productos a los almacenes del municipio de San Jacinto, transportadores que reposan en hostales y que llevan a sus familiares y amigos un producto de Cynthia. Su sueño es tener su propio almacén de artesanías colombianas que diga “hechas en San Jacinto Colombia”. Cynthia está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas como hilos, así como también productos ya elaborados como vestidos ecuatorianos sombreros y ponchos, con esta inversión logrará su éxito porque diversificará con artesanías de otros países y también tendrá un punto de exhibición en su casa debido a que está ubicada en la carretera troncal justamente al lado de un punto comercial que oxigenaría el suyo y a un  lado de su casa planea ella desarrollar su propio almacén de artesanías
texts.en:
Cynthia, 24 years old, learned the tradition of hand-making traditional crafts from her aunt.  Now she knits bags, hammocks, hats, sandals, dresses, and other designs that come to her.  With the techniques of crochet and vertical weaving she has succeeded.  She sells her products in stores in the town of San Jacinto.  Travelers who stay in hostels bring their family and friends one of Cynthia's products.  Her dream is to have her own store of Colombian crafts that say "made in San Jacinto, Colombia".  

Cynthia is applying for her first Kiva loan and her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  to purchase materials such as yarn, and also some pre-made products such as Ecuadorian dresses, hats, and ponchos.  With this investment she will meet her goal because she will diversify with crafts from other countries, and also have a place to exhibit them at her house, since it is located on the main highway next to a commercial area.  She is planning her own craft store next to her house.

loans.use: to purchase primary materials such as yarn, and also pre-made products such as Ecuadorian dresses, hats, and ponchos.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es: La señora Luz Amparo con sus 48 años se encuentra separada de su esposo y ha quedado a cargo de sus dos hijos. Tiene una mente emprendedora, lo que le ha permitido continuar con el negocio familiar de la venta de obleas (snacks) y ha logrado expandirlo hasta vender hacia otros municipios de Antioquia. Busca incrementar la capacidad productiva de su negocio, pues la demanda de su producto es mayor a la que puede atender, por lo que requiere de la compra de 10 planchas más que le permitan incrementar su producción y aumentar sus ventas. De este modo, busca brindarles a sus dos hijos la educación que requieren, y permitirles progresar en un futuro.
texts.en: Señora Luz Amparo, aged 48, is separated from her husband and is in charge of their two children. She has an entrepreneurial spirit, which has allowed her to continue the family business selling wafers (snacks). She could expand it and is now selling wafers in other municipalities of Antioquia. She seeks to expand the production capacity of her business, because her customers want to buy more wafers than she can produce. This is why she needs to buy an additional 10 hotplates to increase her production and sales. Thus she will be able to provide needed education to her two children and ensure their successful future.

loans.use: to buy an additional 10 hotplates for the production of wafers (snacks).

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 29 years old and is married with one child. She owns a grocery shop and has been in this business for 4 years. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her grocery shop. She hopes to open a big grocery shop and be financially stable in the future. Caroline has applied for a loan of 10,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables to stock in his new grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to stock in her new grocery shop.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a business lady who runs a clinic. She previously serviced a loan of 40,000 KES, which she used to decorate her clinic. Since then, she has increased her clientele. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has also been trained on business management skills that have helped her to improve the business.

Everlyne is requesting another loan of 60,000 KES to buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.use: to buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es: Maria Emilia es una emprendedora que ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con un record crediticio excelente, ellas nos expresa que con el financiamiento le ayudaron mucho ya que pudo aumentar su inversión y sus clientes también. Maria Emilia aprendió este negocio empíricamente ya que no tenía trabajo y necesitaba generar ingresos a la familia y tuvo que emprender si saber nada este negocio que junto a sus hijos trabaja para salir adelante. Maria Emilia está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos como ropa para damas, ropa para caballero, ropa para niño, cosméticos, entre otros productos que demanden los clientes.
texts.en: Maria Emilia is an entrepreneur who has worked with Fundación León 2000. She has shown herself to be a responsible person with an excellent credit history. She tells us that the loan helped her a lot since she could increase her investment and her customers as well. Maria Emilia learned this business empirically since she didn't have a job and needed to generate income for her family. She had to start the business without knowing anything bout it and with her children she works to get ahead. Maria Emilia is asking for a loan to buy products such as women's clothing, men's clothing, children's clothing, cosmetics, and more that her customers ask her for.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing, men's clothing, children's clothing, cosmetics, and more.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32 -year-old Hellen from Krootown in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is single with one child age 14 years. Hellen's child attends school. 

Hellen runs a building material store; she sells cement, zinc, sink, pipe, tile, wash hand basin, and toilet covers. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business for 26 days per month. Her source of income comes from renting out a house. Helen says that the main challenge to this business is that during Christmas the sales are very low.

Helen has requested a loan in order to purchase more building material such as flood waste, pipe, tile, sink, and cement. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her child's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a private company. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more building material such as flood waste, pipe, tile,sink, and cement.

loans.name: Estevana Del Socorro

texts.es: Estebaba  de 50 años se dedica a la venta de productos fritos y jugos naturales elaborados con frutas tropicales de la región, como guayaba, aguacate, piña, mango, tamarindo, guanábana etc; Su idea de negocio surgió cuando trabajando con una señora que vendía congelados y fritos en un hotel del centro histórico, decidió hacer lo mismo de manera independiente, así fue como empezó con un capital de trabajo pequeño y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Diariamente su competencia  es mayor y sus costos son superiores a los de la competencia que maneja mejores precios que ella; la razón es que compra por pequeñas cantidades, casi a diario y sus gastos de transporte son superiores,  además de que en sus compras no gana descuentos por las pequeñas cantidades en las cuales obtiene sus productos, porque su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr volúmenes de compra. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprara en mayor cantidad insumos alimenticios, que le permitan competir con buenos precios y un mejor margen de ganancias. Así mismo como tiene  como sus nuevos clientes a las tiendas del sector, podrá responderle a sus pedidos oportunamente, tal como ella lo ha planeado con su credikiva, con el cual tambien le alcanzará para comprar una vitrina y hacer una mejor exhibición de sus fritos.
texts.en:
Estevana, 50, works selling fried products and natural juices made with regional tropical fruits such as guava, avocado, pineapple, mango, tamarind, soursop, etc.  The idea for her business came up when she was working with a woman who was selling frozen and fried snacks in a hotel in the historic district.  She decided to do the same on her own, so she began with a small amount of working capital and little by little it has grown.

Her competition grows every day and her expenses are more than those of the competition, which has better prices.  This is because she buys almost daily in smaller quantities, and her transportation expenses are higher.  Also, she does not earn discounts for her purchases because of the small quantities in which she gets her products, since her working capital is insufficient to get volume sales.

This is the reason she is coming for a Kiva loan, the first loan request she has made to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she will buy food supplies wholesale, which will allow her to compete with good prices and a better profit margin.  Likewise, as she has new customers in the area stores, she will be able to respond to their requests opportunely, just as she has planned it with her Kiva loan, with which she also will buy a display case to make a better display of her fried snacks.

loans.use: to buy food supplies wholesale and a display case.

loans.name: Juan De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Juan de Jesús a sus 54 años de edad se dedica desde su casa a la cría, compra y venta de cerdos en un lugar adecuado que tiene para esta actividad, la cual realiza en una jornada de las 5:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m. desde hace cuatro años. Gracias a esta actividad puede generar su sustento y el de sus dos hijos. Actualmente, el señor Juan de Jesús requiere de la compra de cerdos con el ánimo de poder mejorar sus ventas y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y a futuro cumplir su sueño de ampliar la vivienda de sus cerdos y tecnificar su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan de Jesús, 54 years old, makes a living working from home by raising, buying and selling pigs in a suitable place he has for such activity. His working day has been from 5:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. for the last four years. Thanks to this activity he can provide for himself and for his two children. 

Currently, Juan de Jesús needs to buy pigs with the aim of improving sales. He hopes to be able to improve his quality of life and in the future fulfil his dream of extending the housing for the pigs and of technifying his business.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten up and later sell.

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es:
Esther tiene un negocio de papelería. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con el negocio ya que se levanta desde las 07h00 a tenderlo. Su abuela en ocasiones también le ayuda en la atención vende papelería de todo tipo y algunas prendas de vestir. 

En el futuro quiere continuar apoyando a su familia con el negocio por eso quiere ahora comprar con el préstamo ropa para tener mas variedad para los clientes.
texts.en:
Esther is an entrepreneurial young woman whose mother taught her when she was very young to run their stationary store. She lives outside the city and works together with her mother to generate income for their family.

She has many hopes for the future. This is why she wants to keep working at the store and why she gets up early in the morning to go work there. Her grandmother also helps her out from time to time selling a wide variety of stationary and a few items of clothing.

In the future, she would like to continue supporting her family by working at the store. This is why she wants to use the loan to purchase more clothing in order to offer their customers a greater variety.

loans.use: ropa

loans.name: Orange Group

texts.en:
Rebeca, who is in her early 30s, is married and has three children who are still in school. She has been running a fruit and vegetable business for one year. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rebeca's 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables, to pay household expenses and to start building a house. She has repaid all her loans successfully. Rebeca wants a loan to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to start selling cosmetics and clothes.

Rebeca will share this loan with her group "Orange" which consists of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es: La señora Luz María a sus 48 años se encuentra casada y es madre de 5 hijos. Se dedica a la confección, actividad que realiza desde hace ya varios años en un pequeño espacio de su casa donde confecciona uniformes, vestidos, costuras a sus clientes, entre otros. Debido a que tiene bastantes pedidos, requiere de la compra de insumos que le hacen falta para poder cumplir a sus clientes que siempre la buscan por realizar su trabajo con tan alta calidad. Sueña con poder expandir su área de trabajo y que su negocio incremente sus ventas, para poder brindar a sus hijos la educación y bienes básicos que necesitan.
texts.en:
Luz María, 48 years old, is married and the mother of 5 children. She makes a living sewing, which she has done for several years in a small space in her house. She sews uniforms, dresses, seams for her clients, among other things. 

Due to the fact that she has numerous orders, she needs to buy necessary supplies to be able to satisfy her clients, who always choose her for her high quality work. She dreams of being able to extend her work space and that her business sales increase, in order to give her children the education and basic welfare they need.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread and other supplies for making school bags, backpacks etc.

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 17 y 12 años de edad, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, la tiene instalada en su propia casa y la administra desde hace varios años, su horario es todo el día atender a sus clientes.
Actualmente María está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como huevos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico, esta inversión será de mucha importancia para ella ya que estará surtiendo el negocio para atraer a más clientes para que consuman de sus productos.
La aspiración de ella es que sus hijos tengan todo el apoyo necesario para que puedan desarrollarse en su vida.
texts.en:
María is the single mother of two children, ages 17 and 12.  She runs a store of household products installed in her own home that she has run for several years.  Her schedule to wait on customers is all day.

Currently María is requesting a loan to buy products such as eggs, sugar, rice, beans, oil, and toilet paper.  This investment will be of great importance to her since she will be supplying the business to attract more customers to buy her products.

Her goal is for her children to have the necessary support to be able to develop in their lives.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sugar, rice, beans, oil, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, es comerciante de frutas y verduras, la manera de vender es ambulante, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 5 años, este negocio nació por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso, su horario es de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tomates, zanahorias, chiles, cebollas, manzanas, piña, esta inversión espera le ayude para fortalecer el negocio y poder atender a los clientes.
La proyección de de María es crecer en el negocio, apoyando a sus hijos para que se desarrollen en sus estudios.
texts.en:
María is a street vendor selling fruits and vegetables. She lives with her husband and two children, 16 and 14 years of age. She has had her business for five years and started it due to the need to have a source of income. She works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, carrots, chiles, onions, apples and pineapple. She hopes this investment will help her strengthen her business so she can better serve her customers.

María’s goal is to expand her business and support her children so they can progress in their studies.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, chiles, onions and apples.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca, vive con su madre en casa familiar ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas el negocio lo aprendió debido a la necesidad económica todos los días vende de lunes a domingo.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar la materia prima como: maíz y leña, de esa forma podrá tener lo necesario para mejorar su negocio y tener más clientes el cual podrá incrementar sus ganancias.
El objetivo de Blanca es  siempre mantener estable su negocio y de esa forma podrá darle lo necesario a su madre y tener mejor vida.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her mother in the family home and works selling tortillas, a job she learned to do because of economic necessity. She sells every day, Monday to Sunday. 

She needs a loan to buy basic supplies such as corn and firewood. In this way, she will be able to have what she needs to improve her business and attract more customers so that she can increase her income.

Blanca’s goal is to maintain a steady business so that she will be able to meet her mother’s needs and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, él inicio hace dos años con una panadería, su padre le colabora mucho para la elaboración del pan, con este negocio ha ganado clientela y también ingresos para su familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración del pan, harina, azúcar, levadura, manteca, ya que estos materiales los debe mantener a diario para mejorar la producción del pan.
La aspiración de Oscar es atender mejor la demanda, mejorar sus productos y que su familia sienta su apoyo tanto económico como afectivo.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his wife and two children, who are 6 and 3 years of age. Two years ago he started a bakery. His father helps a great deal in bread making. With this business, he has attracted a clientele and earned an income for her family.

Currently Oscar is requesting a loan to buy basic supplies to make bread: flour, sugar, yeast and shortening, since he needs to have these materials on hand every day to improve his bread production.

Oscar’s goal is to better meet his customers’ demands, improve his products and for his family to feel his support, both economically and emotionally.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and shortening.

loans.name: Raul Efren

texts.es:
Raúl es un padre soltero de 29 años. Su hijo de 4 años cursa el pre kínder. Juntos viven el "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es uno de las 9 cantones de la Provincia de Pichincha ubicado en la zona noroccidental de la misma. Uno de los principales recursos de "San Miguel de Los Bancos" es el hídrico, en su territorio originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. San Miguel de Los Bancos, muestra las características comunes a varios de los pueblos ubicados entre la Sierra y la Costa: el movimiento comercial se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Desde hace unos años se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de pollos que es un oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres. Su vida ha sido relativamente tranquila y no ha tenido mayor inconveniente en su negocio, pero Raúl cree que es hora de crecer, por ello desea solicitar su primer crédito y Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que se lo facilitará ha analizado que es un excelente cliente, por tener todas las condiciones para un crecimiento sólido. Además Raúl recibirá capacitación como servicio no financiero de esta institución.

A este nuevo emprendedor le preocupa mucho la educación de su hijo. Nos cuenta que su meta en la vida es ver al pequeño crecer y poder pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Raúl is a 29-year-old single father. His four-year-old son is in preschool. Together they live in "San Miguel de Los Bancos," which is one of the nine cantons of the province of Pichincha, located in the northwest zone of this province. One of the principal resources of "San Miguel de Los Bancos" is water, as countless streams and small springs originate in this territory and lead to rivers of considerable size.

San Miguel de Los Bancos shows the characteristics common to many of the towns located between the mountains and the coast: commercial activity--especially farming and livestock--unfolds along the main street where hotels, department stores, and restaurants are found. There are also veterinary services and shops for the daily needs of the population.

For a few years he has been raising and selling chickens, a trade that he learned from his parents. His life has been relatively peaceful and he hasn't had any major inconveniences with his business. But Raúl believes it's time to grow, and for this reason he wants to apply for his first loan. Fundación Alternativa, the institution that will provide it, has determined that he is an excellent client for having the conditions for solid growth. Furthermore, Raúl will receive training as a non-financial service from this institution.

This new entrepreneur is very concerned about the education of his son. He tells us that his goal in life is to see his little one grow, and to be able to pay for his studies.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es: A sus 19 años, la joven katherine es madre de un bebé de un año de nacido, buscando generar recursos para el sostenimiento de su hija, inicio hace seis meses con la venta por encargo de mercancía como zapatos, camisas, jeans y ropa interior. Gracias a esta actividad puede conseguir los ingresos necesarios y estar a la vez al cuidado de su hija. Debido al invierno, las ventas de la joven Katherine han disminuido, por lo que necesita de la compra de surtido con el cual pueda reactivar su negocio, mejorar sus ventas y así la calidad de vida de su familia. El sueño de la joven Katherine es ver crecer a su hija y tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
At 19 years of age young Katherine is mother to a one year old baby. Six months ago, looking to generate funds for the sustenance of her daughter, she started selling by order merchandise such as shoes, shirts, jeans and underwear. Thanks to this activity she can obtain necessary income and care for her daughter at the same time. 

Due to the winter, young Katherine's sales have dropped. For this reason she needs to buy assorted clothing to be able to reactivate her business, increase sales and thus improve her family's quality of life. Young Katherine's dream is to see her daughter grow up and to have her own clothing warehouse.

loans.use: buy assorted men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos de primera necesidad, ella inicia su día con los quehaceres del hogar,  tiene también una pequeña granja de cerdos la cual atiende, su horario no es específico, pues esta todo el día en el hogar atendiendo a quienes llegan a comprar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como aceite, arroz, gaseosas, galletas, dulces entre otros productos, de esta manera podrá incrementar y atender mejor a los clientes con productos de calidad.
Su aspiración es de esta compra, surtir y generar mayores ventas, trabajar fuertemente para sacar adelante a su familia en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her three children and husband. She earns her living selling basic supplies. She begins each day with household chores including caring for a small number of pigs. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule but stays around the house all day ready to serve anyone who comes into the store. 

Teresa is seeking a loan to buy merchandise for the store such as oil, rice, soft drinks, cookies, and candy so she can provide her customers with quality items. She hopes that the increased stock in her store will result in greater sales. Teresa works hard to help her family, her children especially, get on in life.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, soft drinks, cookies, candy etc.

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es: La señora Maria Ligia actualmente cuenta con una tienda la cual abrió para ayudarse a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Tiene 7 hijos a los cuales le debe dar el sustento y son los que la animan siempre a buscar una mejor calidad de vida para su hogar. Con el sueño de poder incrementar las ventas de su tienda, la señora Maria Ligia busca abastecer con mayor mercancía su tienda y poder atraer más clientes de su barrio. Con el incremento en sus ventas busca tener una mayor estabilidad económica y que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Ligia has a store that she opened to help cover household expenses.  She has seven children, all of whom she needs to support and who provide her the constant motivation to seek a better quality of life for her family.  With the dream of increasing her store's sales, Maria Ligia wants to stock up with more merchandise to attract more clientele in her neighborhood.  She hopes that with increased sales she'll have more economic stability and her children will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Pelepetua is a single woman in her late twenties. To earn a living, for the past year she has been running a general store. She works from 7 am to midnight, and she is able to earn nice monthly profits from doing so.

This would be Pelepetuas’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, which she successfully repaid, to increase her inventory of items in her shop and to pay school fees. She is now seeking this second loan to again increase her stock of goods to sell to her customers. Pelepetua’s dream is to one day build her own house.

Pelepetua will share this loan with her loan group, "Machimbo," which has a total of 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to expand her store's inventory of goods

loans.name: Mirian Iliana

texts.es:
Mirian, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos, ella tiene su negocio que es un chalet el cual vende comida rápida, pupusas, sodas y golosinas, debido a la necesidad de mantener sola a sus hijos se decidió a poner este negocio y todos los días lo atiende de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar mercadería como: carnes, pollo, verduras y bebidas, el cual le ayudara a tener  variedad y podrá obtener más ingresos diarios.
El sueño de Mirian es con el tiempo poner un comedor en su casa y que su familia viva en mejores condiciones de vida y mejorar cada día en clientes.
texts.en:
Mirian is a single mother and has three children.  She has her business, a store that sells fast food, "pupusas" [stuffed corn tortillas], soda, and sweets.  She decided to install this business because she needed to support her children alone.  She sees to the business every day from Monday through Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as meat, chicken, vegetables, and beverages.  This will help her to have variety, and she will be able to have more daily income.

Mirian's dreams are to install a restaurant in her home in the future, for her family to have better living conditions, and to improve with her customers every day.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, and beverages.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, vive con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a vender ropa el negocio,el cual lo tiene en casa, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería como: blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, solo de ese modo podrá obtener mejores ingresos, debido a la época navideña que es buena porque se vende más y podrá obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Isabel es mantener siempre su negocio estable y siempre trabajar con nuestra institución para que su familia tenga lo necesario para el sostén de la vida.
texts.en:
Isabel lives with her husband and daughter. She sells clothes from her home. She learnt this business from her mother. She has no set working hours.
She will use the loan to buy more merchandise, including blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts and underwear. This is the only way she will be able to get a better income – Christmas is a good time for sales and her income will improve.
Isabel’s dream is to have a steady business and to work with our institution always so that her family can have everything they need for their sustenance.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts, underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make tajadas, tortillas and enchiladas.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is 25 years old, married and a father of one son only. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen and his qualification is up to secondary school only. Previously, he worked as a car mechanic. Then he stopped that work and moved to a business.

In the beginning, he was a worker in a bookshop, selling a variety of bookshop products, document prints and copies. In addition to that, he had a small telecommunications shop. After collecting enough money, he purchased this business from the owner and became in need of funds to purchase more goods in the shop to meet the demands of his clients.

Talal took a loan of 100,000 YR from Alamal Bank, which he will use to purchase additional products to sell and to develop his telecommunications shop.

In the future, he hopes to be a high merchant in order to buy a stationary store and to earn an increased income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and to develop his telecommunications shop

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "SOPE MAME DIARRA " se compose de 6 femme toutes mariées.Elles habitent le meme quartier et s'appuient mutuellement dans leurs activités génératrices de revenus constituées essentiellement de la vente de tissus, de vétements, de draps et de bracelets.Elles achètent en commun dans la capitale et se partagent les marchandises en fonction de l'apport de chaque femme. Elles placent ensuite les articles auprès de leurs clientes qui les paient au bout d'un mois.Ce commerce leur est très utile car leur permettant de satisfaire leurs propres besoins et d'appuyer leurs époux dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien des familles.Le chef de groupe, en foulard jaune , à droite, est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois filles qui vont à l'école.Elle vend des habits pour enfants et génére des revenus qu'elle utilise pour payer les frais de scolarité de ses filles. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, le groupe  sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des vetements, des draps et des tissus "ganila" .Leur ambition est d'agrandir leurs activités.
texts.en: The "Sope Mame Diarra" group comprises six women, all of whom are married. They live in the same area and support each other in their income-generating activities, which consist essentially of selling fabric, clothing, sheets, and bracelets. They buy their goods together in the capital and divide up the merchandise according to each woman's capacity. They then present their goods to their customers, who pay them at the end of the month. This business is very useful to them because it allows them to meet their own needs and support their husbands in taking care of their households. The group leader, in a yellow headscarf, is the mother of four children, three of whom are girls and attend school. She sells children's clothing and earns an income that she uses to pay for the education of her daughters. In order to strengthen their working capital, the group is seeking a loan of 500,000 F to buy clothing, sheets, and "ganila" fabric. Their ambition is to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy clothing, sheets, and "ganila" fabric.

loans.name: Ana Dinora

texts.es:
Ana, es comerciante de ropa, vive con sus tres hijos de 18, 13, y 9 años de edad, ellos le apoyan  en las ventas a Ana, ella lleva 3 años dedicándose a este negocio, que lo inicio por iniciativa propia, trabaja de lunes a viernes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, shorts, pantalones, calcetines, entre otra mercadería que es necesaria para incrementar el negocio y poder estabilizarse en el mercado.
El propósito de Ana es fortalecerse económicamente, con el préstamo, para comprar mercadería nueva que sea la atracción para muchos clientes, también apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Ana is a clothing merchant. She lives with her three children (ages 18, 13, and 9) who help her with making sales. Ana has been in business for three years and started this venture through her own initiative. She works Monday through Friday.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy blouses, shorts, trousers, socks, and other merchandise needed to increase her business and stabilize her position in the marketplace. Her goal is to become stronger financially. With this loan, she will buy new merchandise so that she can attract more customers. In addition, this will help her children with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shorts, trousers, socks, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Bella Estrella

texts.es:
Bella es una madre soltera de 32 años que vive con sus dos hijos, una niña de 5 años y un niño de 8 años. Económicamente, el padre de sus niños, que es un empleado público, se hace responsable con una pensión que recibe mensualmente sin embargo ella también aporta con dinero para así cubrir todas sus necesidades. Desde hace 6 años vive en un barrio central de "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es un cantón que pertenece a la provincia de Pichincha (donde también se encuentra la capital del Ecuador), toda la zona es visitada por sus cascadas, ríos y biodiversidad, el río Mulaute es un sitio de interés turístico, en varios tramos de estos ríos se practica el rafting. La comida típica es la guaña o campeche, que es un pescado que se consume estofado con plátano de tipo denominado orito verde. El ceviche de palmito, la tilapia, lomo a la piedra y el dulce de guayaba.

Hace un poco más de 5 años Bella era una empleada privada, y para tener un ingreso de dinero extra empezó a vender productos de uso personal a sus compañeros de trabajo y luego, al tener gran demanda de estos productos, Bella renunció e instaló su propio local. Aunque la historia sea fácil de contar no ha sido sencillo para esta mujer emprendedora porque la falta de fuentes de financiamiento a nuevos emprendedores es un gran obstáculo. Su jornada de trabajo es de 10 horas al día, y a pesar de que trabaja más horas que cuando era empleada privada, ella se siente feliz ya que es propietaria de su propio capital y además la inestabilidad de los empleos comunes es algo que quedó en el pasado. 

Bella tiene una oportunidad de comprar mercadería, y gracias a un crédito ella podrá obtener mejor precio de sus proveedores y más las buenas ventas de la época navideña, ella podrá tener mejores ingresos y con ello una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos. SU sueño es poder ver a sus hijos siendo unos excelentes profesionales
texts.en:
Bella is a 32-year-old single mother who lives with her two children, a five-year-old daughter and an eight-year-old son. The father of her children is a public employee and is responsible for making a monthly support payment, but this money is not enough to cover all of their needs. For the past six years, Bella has been living in the central neighborhood of “San Miguel de Los Bancos” which is in a canton in Pichincha Province (the Ecuadorian capital is also in this province). This entire area is surrounded by waterfalls, rivers, and biodiversity. The Mulaute River is a tourist spot where several sections of the river are designated for rafting. The traditional dish is either “guaña” or “campeche”, which are types of fish that are usually eaten with a variety of banana named “orito verde”. Also popular is a “ceviche” (marinated seafood cocktail) made with hearts of palm, tilapia, and sweet guava.

Bella was a private employee for a little more than five years, but to earn some extra income she began selling personal use products to her co-workers. Due to the great demand for her products, Bella quit her job and opened her own store. Although her story sounds effortless, things have not been easy for this enterprising woman because her greatest obstacle is a lack of funding for her new projects. Bella works 10 hours each day. Even though she works more hours than she did as a public employee, Bella is happy to have her own capital. In addition, experiencing instability in her job was something common that she experienced in the past.

Bella has the opportunity to buy merchandise. Thanks to this loan, she can obtain a good price from her suppliers and generate good sales during the Christmas season. She will have more income and a better quality of life for herself and her children. Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk.
